item.text: Electronic dark rock inspired by Manchester and Düsseldorf.
item.description:
Every now and then temperatures run extremely low in the remote regions of Norway. You can hear it on a band like 120 Days from Kristiansund.

The Norwegians play cold, dark electronic rock that sounds like Kraftwerk’s hometown Düsseldorf in the 70s and Manchester in the 90s.

120 Days do not overburden their audience with a deluge of albums. Instead, the band's sound has been allowed to mature, grown and mutate. With 120 Days II
 (the follow-up to the debut album from 2006) the Norwegians prove that a long maturation process can do good for electronic dark rock. The record bodes well for a rock rave full of laser lights, Norwegian cold degrees and house hypnosis.

Label: Smalltown Supersound/VME

item.text: Roots reggae from when the genre was young.
item.description:
The original nobility of reggae invites you to their court at Roskilde Festival. The Abyssinians’ song ”Satta Massagana” from 1969 is regarded by many as the defining hymn of Rastafarian culture.

The core members of the band are grey-haired veterans today. But The Abyssinians continue to spread the message of revolution and their sun-soaked musical genre, which during their career has become a cherished far from the beaches of Jamaica.

The Abyssinians are a must see for any reggae and dub aficionado. Show up and experience the history and some genuine Jamaican legends. Hang around for the beautiful vocal harmonies and the spiritual chanting for Jah, the king of kings.

item.text: Hyperkinetic bass music with elements of Chicago and Bristol.
item.description:
The influential Brit Antony Williams already made a name for himself on the dubstep scene when he collected scalps under the moniker Headhunter. But it's as Addison Groove that he has made his biggest impact on the bass music scene – especially with the unforgettable "Footcrab".

Addison Groove combines naughty Chicago-esque clubbing sounds like juke or ghetto house with British bass and dubstep using cool synth themes, trippy 808 drum machines and looped vocal samples.

You have to possess a backside made of stone to be able to sit still when faced with the result of this genre mash-up.

Label: 50 Weapons / import

item.text: Dance pop with a high hit frequency.
item.description:
Adrian Lux immodestly claims that he cannot write anything but hits. This is more than boasting from a Swedish Adonis.

"Can't Sleep", "Strawberry" and "Teenage Crime" have already proven their worth on both the charts and the dance floors.

With his carefree blend of house and pop, the young DJ, producer and musician with the high voice has already won over Tiësto, Justice and the Swedish House Mafia.

Now it's your turn to be convinced.

Label: Ultra / Universal

item.text: British bass sound with an African aftertaste.
item.description:
Mark Pritchard and Steve Spacek are two experienced and respected lads in progressive electronic music.

With Africa Hitech the two Brits weave together a global-scented sound tapestry that contains traces of not only Africa and the Caribbean but also Chicago and London's steamy nightclubs.

The result is a psychedelic hotchpotch of robotic rhythms, bass, ghost vocals and vitamin-D-rich equator sun. A kind of digital multiple wedding between dubstep, ghetto house and drowsy techno in the middle of the African savannah.

item.text: Swingin’ soul and rampant R&B from the South.
item.description:
Few places have defined the sound of the American South as much as the state of Alabama, and few bands manage to combine good old-fashioned greasy soul with genuine R&B as much as Alabama Shakes.

With the debut album Boys & Girls on the move from hype to hit lists, the quartet from Athens, Alabama prove that their musical intensity and sense of tradition have far from suffered from the fact that they are one of the hottest bands at the moment.

Singer and guitarist Brittany Howard has already been named the next big queen of rock, so don’t miss a tasteful and swinging bite of the South.

Label: Rough Trade / Playground

item.text: Central Asian music clan with a multi-cultural sound.
item.description:
With foothold in the percussive traditions of Central Asia, several generations of The Alaev Family perform together. The age span is, according to themselves, 15 to 79.

In 1991 the entire Alaev family immigrated from Tajikistan to Israel. You will notice this in the multi-ethnical music, which employs accordions, angry violins and Turkish-sounding scales on the clarinet. The music grooves with more exhilaration than a wedding where half of Tel Aviv is invited.

With The Alaev Family you will get a cheerful demonstration of how ancient family traditions can withstand the tooth of time and be carried forward proudly by younger generations. This is further evidence to the fact that Israel has become the centre of several exciting genre clashes.

Label: High Fidelity / Import

item.text: The First Couple of African music.
item.description:
In the light of their numerous appearances at Roskilde Festival, we are proud to call Amadou & Mariam – Africa's musical First Couple – true regulars.

Africa, or Mali to be precise, has never sounded as accessible as it does with these blind veterans. The pair unites funk, rock, tribal song and pop in a musical mixture, which is both melodious by Western standards and full of African flavour.

Santigold, TV On The Radio and several other Western VIP's feature on the duo's latest record Folila. A fine example of the blurring of borders in music, which has become a trademark for the duo as well as Roskilde Festival.

Label: Because Music / Warner­

item.text: The American song treasury in new clothes.
item.description:
The American song treasury is a chest loaded with rubies, jewels and pure gold.

With ukulele and acoustic guitar as the only accompaniment, Sam Amidon interprets and renews old folk songs and hymns. Only occasionally you get to hear songs by artists such as R. Kelly or Tears For Fears. This New Yorker has promoted a rich music heritage to a new generation.

Experience how rustic songs with the right interpreter can quiver of longing, loneliness and raw wisdom of life as if the ink in the songbook was still wet.

Label: Bedroom Community / import

item.artistName: AMSTERDANCE feat. JESSE VOORN, DENNIS CHRISTOPHER and SAM O’NEALL
item.text: House, techno and trance from Amsterdam's finest suppliers.
item.description:
Under the banner Amsterdance, two enterprising and local-patriotic music lovers have created a concept that brings Amsterdam's red-hot club scene over the Dutch border.

At Roskilde Festival 2012 you can experience shooting star DJ Jesse Voorn who knows how to distribute his progressive house across the continents. His radio show is listened to in more than 15 countries, and he tours as a DJ from Miami to Moscow.

During this club extravaganza you can also experience one of Dennis Christopher's raw and powerful DJ sets and Sam O'Nealls innovative and funky ditto.

It will be a night full of an irresistible combination of deep tribal-like beats, minimal trance-inducing structures. At the same time you sense a pop sensibility amid the edgy house, techno and trance.

The team behind Amsterdance creates a hot celebration, worthy of Holland's most famous and infamous city.

Analogik's crazy but good-natured blend of wind music, accordion playing, surf and Dixieland jazz is just right for wonderfully absurd and totally unpredictable concerts.

The cheerful hippies proved so at Roskilde Festival in 2009. In 2012 we welcome them back as a well-traveled, more experienced, more bearded, equally nuts ensemble.

Earlier, Analogik looked towards the Balkans. On the coming full length New Seeland inspiration is particularly found in Ethiopia. Whichever way you approach this genre-transcending party music, one thing is certain: Analogik is a group of daredevils who have more fun on exotic paths than on the beaten track.

Label: Jenka Music / VME

item.text: Seance from the future led by forces from a-ha, Mew and Coldplay.
item.description:
The future has arrived at Roskilde Festival. It is called Apparatjik.

With an until now unseen coupling of pop music, quantum theory and rocket science, the four man super group has ventured into the same regions of the galaxy found in the dreams of only the most daring science fiction authors.

A group containing super producer Martin Terefe and members of Mew, Coldplay and a-ha ensures that the music holds a dream-like, floating sensation as well as highly catchy synth melodies. At the same time it is evident that Apparatjik has put on the space suits and severed the connection to our blue-green world.

Expect yet another unique experiment with the concept of concert at Roskilde Festival – equal parts electronic pop party and revolutionary art installation.

Label: A:larm

A session with AraabMuzik is a superior display of virtuoso skills, darkening the future of the guitar solo.

With his beat-up MPC – an advanced drum and sample machine – as a starting point, Abraham Orellana creates harsh, cut-up, MC-free hip hop that mutates between trance, mash-up, dubstep and countless other urban, electronic genres.

"You are now listening to AraabMuzik", you’re told time and time again on the breakthrough album Electronic Dream. It’s a self-conscious swagger but also a necessary anchorage point in the middle of a hot and schizophrenic show of force.

Label: Duke Productions / import

item.text: Classical vocal ensemble performs composers from the 20th century.
item.description:
Ars Nova gives you a glimpse of another world.

In the middle of Roskilde Festival's many throbbing rhythms and amplified sounds, one of Europe's leading vocal ensembles join in, ready to tickle the senses with an eclectic programme of advanced choral music.

With the acclaimed conductor Paul Hillier at the helm, Ars Nova fills the space with harmony, classical beaut, carousel-rotating loops and hypnotic repetition.

At this Roskilde debut, the honoured ensemble will focus on minimalist works from the 20th century by Terry Riley, David Lang, Steve Reich, Philip Glass and Arvo Pärt.

Label: DaCapo

item.text: The new golden boy of New York hip hop.
item.description:
Rakim Mayers, better known as A$AP Rocky, has rapped his way onto the hiphop VIP list with certainty. And with plenty of reasons for this “pretty motherfucker” to brag.

A$AP Rocky is flamboyant hiphop from a self-assured innovator of the New York school. This golden boy’s songs deals with illegal smoking waxed sports car, Cristal, women thighs and rustled dollar bills.

LiveLoveA$AP consolidated A$AP Rocky’s potential within the wide music press – his mixtape offers several reasons to why you should look forward to this rapper’s Roskilde debut as well.

Label: Polo Grounds / Sony Music

Originally, the impeccably dressed Baloji was a member of the popular hip hop collective Starflam. But after having decided to put life as a musician behind him, his Congolese background came knocking on his door.

The solo debut album Hotel Impala was a response to a letter from his mother back home in Congo. They hadn’t seen each other for about 25 years. The album became a success and placed Baloji in the field of central European African-inspired hip hop.

Congolese funk and raw rumba are ingeniously manifested through soul, rap and Afrobeat in organic hand-played music with French, Swahili and Bantu as native languages; “Afropean” is what this re-emerging musician calls himself.

Label: Crammed Dics / import

The originally black-coloured metal genre has long since exploded in fireworks of colours and genre shifts.

Baroness have with Red Album and Blue Record made a name for themselves as one of the most progressive front-runners of Southern metal, alongside like-minded Roskilde acts such as Mastodon and Kylesa.

Power metal, psychedelia and dirty 70s rock are thrown into the cement mixer, and out comes a refined, majestic and crushingly brutal rock monster.

Baroness master a balancing act that many bands should envy. Their music is full of artiness and curlicues but will still excite the many beer-thirsty rock fans at the festival site.

Label: Relapse / Cosmos Music Group

Forget spinning for a while. The circus punks from The Barons of Tang will make you pogo so hard that the loss of calories will be the same.

Gogol Bordello fans should prepare to point their arms skyward. Fans of Ornette Coleman, Frank Zappa and Mr. Bungle will also appreciate the mastery of instruments and the many changes in genre.

With their mix of polka, hardcore, tango and brass, the insane Aussies create cacophonic concerts that leave the audience bruised, battered – and ready for more.

A manic ride across the plains filled with punk attitude and a gipsy twinkle in the eye.

Label: The Planet Company / import

The do-it-yourself philosophy, DIY, thrives well in an age when anyone can buy some sparse equipment and release their material online.

The Beardy Durfs are offshoots of this school. The two lads from Copenhagen make broken-up noise rock that mixes white noise with sonic pleasure. From psychedelically shimmering beauty to aggressive, minimal punk.

The Beardy Durfs are nectar from the Copenhagen underground.

Label: Pad and Pen / Target Distribution

The Copenhagen-based nightclub Dunkel houses some of the city's most interesting electronic sounds. People, who have visited the club, might have listened to producer Tobias Pedersen who is a house DJ and booking agent for the dark rooms.

The Dane’s rhythms are a mix of electro, techno, dubstep and especially drum'n'bass.

Beastie Respond presents some exciting dark sounds that may soon bring him out of the nightclub darkness and towards an even bigger audience.

Label: Teal

Poland is home of more than God-fearing Catholics. The East European country has a respected death metal scene where Behemoth takes the black throne as one of the most controversial and constantly innovative bands.

They are no newbies: Behemoth has put out albums since the early 90s – all of them full of intense nightmares. Nowadays, the corpse-painted Poles are touring internationally with their spectacular live shows while at home the debate rages about the band's anti-Catholic messages.

Behemoth makes the ground tremble with their demonically well-executed and refined extreme metal.

Label: Nuclear Blast / Warner

item.text: Neither Portishead nor Radiohead can make the Brits dance like the sound of Bellowhead.
item.description:
Neither Portishead nor Radiohead can make the Brits dance like the sound of Bellowhead.

The quintessentially English 11-man band has taken the traditional folk music of their motherland and applied a massive touch, which has resulted in Bellowhead being awarded best live band as many as five times at the BBC Folk Awards.

With brass, fiddle, accordion and lute, the atmosphere of old pipe-smoking England is spread instantly. However, the anarchistic virtuoso musicians readily draw on jazz, funk, and marching bands as well.

Bellowhead has played during the intro on The Simpsons, developed their own type of ale and visited Roskilde Festival back in 2006. Now it’s again time to dust off the tweed jacket and shine the dancing shoes.

Label: Navigator / import

In 2011 Jarle Bernhoft has risen to a position as one of the undisputed soul kings of Scandinavia. And the gentleman with the sharp haircut has proven to be much more than just some one-hit-wonder.

Bernhoft’s sublime voice has earlier been one of the greatest characteristics of the rock band Span, but it is as a solo artist that the entire world is about to discover the extent of this great talent.

Backed by an 11-men swinging band, Bernhoft creates a show oozing of sweet soul pop, as if this Norwegian was on first name terms with soul and R&B giants as Curtis, Stevie and Michael.

Label: Kikitépe Cassette/Target Distribution

item.text: Semi-nostalgic hip hop from the Southern states.
item.description:
Mississippi rapper Big K.R.I.T. has been buzzing around the hip hop underground scene for some years, but it is only now that this extremely talented producer and rapper is about to break through.

His critically acclaimed mixtape Return Of 4eva is hip hop in the tradition of the Southern states in the 90s: filled with easy-flowing soul, organic sensations and plenty of parallels to Outkast and Underground Kingz.

Chicks and cars are obvious themes in hip hop, a genre favouring self-assertion rather than self-hatred. To that, Big K.R.I.T. has added social consciousness, self-irony, a sharp tongue and a brilliant flow, features increasing the pleasure of this semi-nostalgic hip hop.

Label: Def Jam / import

Björk has, like few others, combined broad appeal with artistic eccentricity. She is at once a musical sorceress with Icelandic lava flowing through the veins, iconic pop star and electronic wonder kid. Throughout the last 18 years, each new album has been a bold move in a new direction, and Roskilde Festival has been one of the regular stops on her musical travels.

With Biophilia from October Björk again takes a leap forward. Each new song on the album is followed by an app. But like in concert, the visual inventiveness never overshadows the music. Björk proves again that she can harmonise the organic and electronic elements in a personal expression full of adventure, experimentation and melody.

One Little Indian / Universal

The Bronx is the birthplace hip hop. Many people know that. But before then, the beleaguered New York hood was also home of salsa dura – or 'hard salsa' – characterised by its political indignation and the clear African connection in the hard percussion work.

Rubén Blades is 'Mr. salsa dura' and can write several titles on his business card – both lawyer, politician and actor. However, it's as a singer and musician that the Panama legend's star is biggest.

With the characteristic piano riffs, congas and brass, Rubén Blades is ready to start up a pure salsa party.

Label: Import

item.text: Hip hop packed with brass and Afrobeat.
item.description:
“It’s not where you’re from; it’s where you’re at,” Chuck D observes on Blitz The Ambassador’s critically acclaimed album Native Sun. This line from the legendary Public Enemy front man frames the transatlantic hip hop by Blitz The Ambassador pretty well.

Samuel Bazawule was raised in Accra, Ghana, but still manages to rap in double pace, matching anybody in his current hometown of New York.

With his faithful backing band The Embassy Ensemble, this musical mastermind delivers hip hop carried on a golden throne of funky brass music and Afrobeat-inspired guitar. The term Afro-American has rarely been more fitting.

Label: Embassy MVT / import

Zach Steinman and Sam Haar only rarely choose the easy way through the labyrinth of electronic dance music.

The Brooklyn duo Blondes weave long, stretched sound patterns, which most of all resemble something from a remote and soothing universe. This is floating mid-tempo techno composed by people apparently more concerned with the seesaw movement of intergalactic space than the rumbling of the dance floor.

Climb aboard with Blondes and imagine yourself dancing slowly through a nebula on the far side of Jupiter.

Label: RVNG Intl. / import

The South American electronic cumbia scene has experienced an enormous boost in recent years. Bomba Estéreo leads this brightly coloured wave.

Roskilde Festival 2009 was their first encounter with a Western music festival. Today, they are so sought-after that it would turn many a Western rock band green with envy. Roskilde Festival still holds a special place in their hearts – they stayed in the camping area during the entire festival last time they visited – and they are as happy as we are for the reunion.

The Columbians' hot dance music contains, beside cumbia folk music, traces of dub, psychedelic rock and hip hop. Electro tropical is what Bomba Estéreo have named their steaming hot urban sound.

Label: Polen / import

According to the story, Justin Vernon created the sobbingly beautiful For Emma, Forever Ago in a lonely cabin in the middle of the winter wilderness.

On the self-titled album from 2011 Vernon has extended his sound with a big, well-playing band and appears as a progressive folk artist with a penchant for soft rock, grandiose sounds and instrumental digressions.

The transformation has not reduced Bon Iver’s place in the hearts of audience. The bearded American with the fabulous falsetto is now in top 10 of the hottest Roskilde requests in the company of the biggest stars, stadium bands and legends.

Bon Iver has left the hermitage cabin and really stepped into the spotlight.

4AD / Playground

Nature-loving Bowerbirds are part of the wildly diverse and bearded American free folk genre. The duo sings faithful harmonies about flora and fauna making it hard not to drift away in dreams of a clearing in the woods far from the path of others.

The sense of fresh air and organic farming float around these songs, which are typically accompanied by guitar, accordion, violins and just a touch of muffled drums.

Naive and old-fashioned? Maybe. But also containing a strong sense of translation of naturalistic poetry and idyllic, memorable tunes. Bowerbirds sing to the hippie child in all of us.

Label: Dead Oceans / VME

The internationally acclaimed guitarist Jakob Bro’s weightless jazz is part of an exciting mix with electronica when he and Thomas Knak (Opiate, Future 3, People Press Play) pulls newly composed material in an interesting new direction.

The pieces were originally thought of as simple sketches more than actual songs, but later they have been turned into real compositions and productions in a cut/paste process, which now sets the scene for an upcoming album.

An exciting sneak preview at a crossover between genres and ways of thinking.

Label: Loveland

Det här är inte New York (this is not New York) is the title of Bäddat För Trubbel's debut album. Damn straight! This is the sound of Malmö's underground punk scene in all its charismatic, proletarian and hungover splendour.

The songs are obviously sung in Swedish with lots of double dots over the vowels, but even in the US they have discovered that the lads' uncomplicated punk can make the language barriers crumble like Wasa crispbread.

Bäddat För Trubbel makes Malmö sound like a pünk capital in its golden age.

Brooklyn has become a mecca for the bespectacled hipster. But the New York hood also has a tradition of angry hardcore.

Cerebral Ballzy seems madly in love with 80s hardcore punk like Black Flag and Minor Threat. The young New Yorkers play aggressively, fast and loud.

This is not a punk band that has memorised Marx's Das Kapital. It’s rather a flock of hungry young lions ready to vanquish pop punk such as Green Day and Blink 182 from the musical world map.

Cerebral Ballzy gives Brooklyn a renaissance as a place where your hipster glasses will be crushed if you head in the wrong direction.

Label: Adult Swim / import

The debut album is still on its way, but already on the EP Halo Of Syringes you are convinced about the potential in these students of old-school death metal. They are called Cerekloth.

Lead singer JBP has a growl so animalistic and full of rottenness that you almost see the maggots come creeping out of his mouth. The rest of the band play just as crushingly tight.

Roskilde Festival 2012 will be yet another metal fest out of the ordinary. Get in shape early with Cerekloth.

Label: Hells Headbanger

item.text: DJ specialising in Africa, South America and chasing the obscure.
item.description:
Through Soundway Records Miles Cleret secures the future for loads of golden music from especially Africa and South America. On his small label the fireball gathers obscure funk, blues and soul from the farthest reaches of the two massive continents and invites a new generation of listeners to join in.

A session with this acclaimed collector and musical intermediary can offer anything from highlife and Afro disco to cumbia and calypso.

Miles Cleret has released more than 25 records with exquisite finds and comes to Roskilde Festival with a buffet of the best delicious bites from the collection.

Label: Soundway / import

Multi-instrumentalist Guy Connely has been making noise in the corners of the blogosphere for a few years as a remixer and originator of his cut-up 'chop pop' where samples, fragments and collages play an essential part.

This year the alias Clock Opera with the debut album Ways To Forget enters the stage as a synth rock band with full-fledged melodies and windy stadium atmosphere. Connely’s expressive vocals soar beautifully over both the open and rich arrangements that still contain the electronic geek’s preference for playful details and abundant wealth.

The melodic, grandiose feeling can make Clock Opera one of the ideal acquaintances for fans of forward-thinking electronic pop.

Label: Moshi Moshi / Universal

’Doom soul’, she calls her music. Canadian act Cold Specks’ bony arrangements sound more like classic, American blues folk with a distinctive singer at the centre.

Close your eyes while the music is playing and you can almost sense cotton-harvesting Southern states of bygone times.

With soft pickings on her acoustic guitar – occasionally accompanied by a little cello and piano – Al Spx creates a goosebumps-inducing atmosphere. Full of dust, patina and longing for deliverance. A brand-new debutant with a voice from the old days.

Label: Mute / Playground

The visionary drum'n'bass legend Goldie fired the duo Commix towards the stars.

Their original mix of breakbeats, house, jazz and lots more has burst the musical boundaries of drum'n'bass.

Few artists are able to give you chills the way Commix are with their synth and rustling metal sounds, while making you break a hip while trying to follow the deep bass.

Commix will last way past their own sell-by date.

Label: Metalheadz / import

item.text: Sun-soaked guitar delirium led by honourable veterans.
item.description:
Like many other African countries, Angola has been subject to bitter, regional conflict - among other things the vast number of internal wars strangled the rich, Panafrican musical epoch of the 1970s. A series of veterans are remedying this with Conjunto Angola 70.

Using a golden brown mix of African and Caribbean genres, these masters revive the golden age making you have inner visions of bellbottom pants.

The delirious guitar playing – not least by Teddy N'Singuis who, according to many, is the most skilled six-string player in Angola – steps to the foreground when Conjunto Angola 70 takes you back in time on an ecstatic journey.

Label: Analog Africa / import

item.text: A unique musical collaboration with leading bands from the Copenhagen underground.
item.description:
We present a unique marathon show, designed especially for Roskilde Festival.

A handful of Copenhagen-based bands has created a joint platform with Copenhagen Collaboration. A union to strengthen the sense of community and the ties that are already thriving in the Copenhagen music underground. Alcoholic Faith Mission, CODY, Sleep Party People, Hellraiserten, Monkey Cup Dress, Stærosaurus, Before the Show, From Sarah, You. You. You. and Ondt and the Gracehoper now live out these sympathetic ideals.

This array of bands weave together a totally unique concert. Focus is on the alternative rock of the first three bands, from melancholic americana to creeping eerieness.

With almost 30 musicians from Copenhagen's alternative scene on stage, you can look forward to a different experience where the numerous musicians enlarge, rethink and reinterpret the collective's songs. Copenhagen Collaboration emphasises a sense of community over individualised consideration and lets the songs flow together in a gigantic multi-concert. Only at Roskilde Festival.

Oscar Rumble and Michael Korch cross beats, bass and bangers under the name Copenheavy.

They are a duo from Copenhagen who is touring all over Denmark and who has achieved a big fan base in short time.

With a starting point in hard electro and dubstep, they make the party boil over.

Copenheavy delivers heavy bass for the masses, and their hot tunes are strained to the breaking point as if the two lads were going for Skrillex' throne.

Samba, rap, Afrobeat and soul seamlessly blend together in Criolo's versatile and grandiose orchestrations.

After being practically unknown for years, success has arrived after the Brazilian has turned 30 – and with retroactive effect. The breakthrough album Nó Na Orelha really demonstrates the superiority of Portuguese as a language for rap.

The rapper, commentator and poet Criolo exposes the problems of Brazil, from deforestation to police violence in the favelas. His legendary countryman Caetano Valoso has already recognised Criolo's role as a protester and critic of society.

Label: Sterns / Import

Evergreen tunes on a bed of guitar, bass and drums have thrilled the world since the Beatles took Hamburg as a young band.

Mikal Cronin delivers garage pop songs filled with great melodies and classic songwriting – even if it all is a bit more distorted than when mom and dad were flower children.

Fans of American garage rock will recognise Cronin’s name from The Moonhearts and his collaboration with Ty Segall where the young American has had a great brooding environment for his live-based, raw and melodic songs.

With his debut album, Cronin has started a career based on sweet, psychedelic, sometimes noisy music with the catchy song as objective, means and purpose.

Label: Trouble in Mind / import

Kirk Windstein will – despite gigs in Down – always remain synonymous with Crowbar who, like few other bands, have incarnated the murky sludge metal genre with their tuned-down riffs, lazy grooves and roaring vocals.

The hefty chaps have retained their metal style since the early 90s, unaffected by any fads. According to the front man, the current lineup is the best in the history of the band.

Sonic Excess In Its Purest Form is the title of one of the band's most famous albums. The title gives a good impression of the bone-crushing embrace which is the epitome of Crowbar.

Label: eOne / Import

With a foothold in goth rock and heavy metal and a deep fascination by mysticism and the occult, The Cult have been practicing stadium rock for more than 25 years.

Ian Astbury and Bill Duffy's shamanistic rock band has a long and diverse history. Astbury has also performed with members of The Doors in the band Riders On The Storm.

This year will see the release of Choice Weapon, the first album from The Cult in five years. Duffy's classic riffs and Astbury's powerful presence on stage are the essence of good ol' rock with heavy balls and poetic fire. Think a congregation of The Doors, Black Sabbath and Led Zeppelin on a windy mountaintop.

Join The Cult – there is plenty of room for new converts.

Label: New Wilderness / VME

item.text: Visit from Robert Smith and his black-clad band.
item.description:
Few other bands have incarnated the black-clad music scene of the 80s with as wide appeal as The Cure.

Dark-edged albums such as Pornography and Disintegration have secured Robert Smith a legendary status among rock critics. At the same time, The Cure is popular among a wide audience because of hits such as "Close To Me" and "Friday I'm In Love".

The concert at Roskilde Festival is a great chance to experience the Brits’ grandiose, gothic rock live under the Scandinavian summer's sky.

Look forward to a legendary band that has lifted Roskilde Festival several times earlier with their grandiose, immortal songs from the inner chamber of the soul.

Label: Geffen / Universal

Chris Douglas has existed in the dark outer reaches of electronic music for 20 years. His music is abstract and labyrinthine but also forward-gazing and quite often astoundingly beautiful.

Throughout a long career using different monikers (among others O.S.T., Dalglish and Rook Vallade), the Berlin resident, nomadic pioneer has explored – and partially developed – genres like IDM, dance-hostile techno and dark ambient.

Dalglish takes us on a journey through a sinister borderland of syncopated rhythms and industrial darkness. The nightmarish soundtrack skitters and leaps chaotically like evil insects in the underground where the sunlight is unable to penetrate.

Label: Record Label / import

Dangers Of The Sea consists of members from several well-known Danish bands. They have found common ground in a shared musical vision. They ensure a high level of country-scented, 70s-nostalgic folk rock songs.

In singer Andreas Bay Estrup's musical universe it as always dusk and the leaves keep on falling. Dangers Of The Sea are disciples of Neil Young's semi-sad school – Nordic Americana on a par with the great talents on the other side of the Atlantic.

Elena Tonra, front woman in Daughter, is only in her early 20s. But her downhearted but very expressive songs have enough bittersweet experience to match the American singer-songwriter queen Cat Power.

Her songs are sparsely arranged – often with the acoustic guitar as the only accompaniment. Tonra's delicate voice is so rich in nuances, colours and blues that a big backing orchestra would seem decidedly misplaced in Daughter's minimal but effective folk.

Label: 4AD / Playground

"He who fears death cannot enjoy life," is the basic philosophy of psychedelic, death-embracing trance rock band Dead Skeletons.

Their music is like straying into a maelstrom of roaring, echoing guitars, staring skeleton heads, Buddhist trance and cosmic rock'n'roll. Like Suicide, The Brian Jonestown Massacre and Velvet Underground would sound in front of the gates of Hades, in a desperate attempt to keep the Grim Reaper at bay with a sonic attack.

Dead Skeletons are morbid celebration music for music lovers who prefer black sound waves.

Label: A Records / import

The band name originates from an EP by the corpse-painted legends Mayhem. Still Norwegian black metal is just one of many ingredients in Deathcrush.

The trio's unique sound is noise rock spiced up with a bit of dark evil from up North; New Yorker-cool guitar abuse by a band that rips, screeches and tears, while at the same time is unafraid of being catchy.

The verdict made by the already initiated crowd is practically clear-cut: Deathcrush is one of tomorrow's most exciting and cool noise rock bands.

Get the evil spirits out of the system with Devildriver.

Dez Fafara and his companions are deservedly praised for their extensive service at metal venues all over the world.

The American favourites have eaten their way up the food chain as a heavily touring metal band with a penchant for eruptive live concerts, hard-tuned drums and general aggression.

The starting point for the four Californian comrades is pumped-up thrash, hardcore and death metal in well-balanced doses.

Devildriver is just as effective for keeping the demons at bay as the bells the band name refers to.

Roadrunner / Warner

Danish band Dig & Mig’s innocent pop punk has taken shape in the Danish punk underground – but the wide audience has quickly caught on.

Sune Wagner from The Raveonettes has produced the duo, and you can easily hear why.

Listening to Dig & Mig like a meeting between the Danish 80s band Rocazino and Ramones – both ultra nostalgic and with the same nerve and attitude as the other great punk bands shooting from the Copenhagen underground right now.

Label: Universal

The cover of Django Django’s self-titled debut album looks like a digitally manipulated, psychedelic tumbleweed floating through the desert towards the listener. The image describes this sought-after and critically acclaimed band’s music very well.

With a sun-soaked mixture of tribal music, fragmented rhythms, semi-electric rock and laid back psychedelia, the young Scotsmen inhabit a universe that brings back memories of both American and British golden pop. Meanwhile there is an exotic atmosphere – as if Django Django is floating away on exotic Bedouin expeditions in the middle of the prosaic, British surroundings.

Label: Because Music / Warner

item.text: Hip hop wonder girl with a speedy tongue.
item.description:
Florida's perhaps most beautiful and hottest rapper dreams big as she prepares for world domination. With her fast staccato rap, Dominique Young Unique has placed her name in the corner where young urban queens such as Nicki Minaj, Santigold and M.I.A reign.

Her three mixtapes have caught people’s ears. In addition, Miss Unique has performed with Big Boi, Gucci Mane and N.E.R.D among others. Also, Kanye West has taken notice of the girl with a speedy tongue, who also prepares to create her own fashion collection.

Don’t miss out on this one, boys and girls. Dominique Young Unique is raw, fresh and ready for you to worship her.

Label: Art Jam / Import

item.artistName: DR. JOHN AND THE LOWER 911 feat. JON CLEARY
item.text: The voodoo rock medicine man is back.
item.description:
Since the acid-rocking breakthrough with Gris-Gris from the late 60s, Dr. John's swampy voodoo funk rock has become an institution.

The great medicine man's latest album Locked Down – produced by The Black Keys' Dan Auerbach – is a round of classic swinging roots rock filled with golden Farfisa organ, brass, female choir singers and a well-oiled showy feel.

In the middle of the rocking tunes you also sense the African inspiration, which has always been present with this piano boxer, guitarist and rock guru from Louisiana's steamy swamps.

Dr. John and his band are assisted by another experienced band leader and piano magician from New Orleans, Jon Cleary.

When hearing Dry The River, you get a sense of a rustic musician's collective from the US. Even if their nationality is British and the band members' past involves emo and post-punk rather than sensitive folk music.

One thing is certain, though. This is an obvious new acquaintance for all wearers of lumberjack shirts. With richly orchestrated folk rock arrangements, Dry The River plays songs filled with melodrama and views over the steppes. At the same time the band has a muscular nerve, enabling them to stand shoulder to shoulder with the sensitive acts your mom would like and at the same time arm wrestling with punk bands.

Label: RCA / Sony Music

Imagine Blondie's Debbie Harry bitten by a bat filled with a vampire virus.

That is just about the sound of the blonde but darkened Iza Mortag Freund who with controlled screaming vocals stand on the shoulders of other queens of darkness such as Lydia Lunch and Siouxsie Sioux.

James Brook provides stripped down rock'n'roll, drum machine and 80s synths, taking you back to a sexy goth club deep beneath the city streets.

The Echo Vamper is a must for all fans of haunted, black new wave.

Label: A:larm

item.artistName: EL PARAISO presents CAUSA SUI, EL PARAISO ENSEMBLE and PAPIR
item.text: Thick, cosmic acid from the Copenhagen underground.
item.description:
The Danish music underground is full of acid and marvelous mushroom shots. El Paraiso is a new Danish record label focusing on experimental, mind-expanding music.

Causa Sui has developed into a cult band. The Danes' 60s-sounding acid rock is full of cosmic jazz, Woodstock feeling and out-there solos so that the psychedelic colours almost run down the walls.

The Copenhagen trio Papir combines machanical krautrock and post-rock and adds a special intensity and ferocity.

El Paraiso Ensemble is a band put together especially for Roskilde 2012 and featuring specially invited guests on a journey into an electronic, remote universe filled with analogue synthesizers and psychedelic guitar grooves.

Label: El Paraiso

You almost don’t believe it. Elektro Guzzi enjoys the best company on the European electronic scene and plays at all the leading venues of the genre. However, the three Austrians renounce everything that has to do with loops, sequencing and laptops. Elektro Guzzi’s tripping minimal techno is played on bass, guitar and drums.

Their long instrumental sequences mimic the hypnotic 4/4 sensation of techno. At the same time, their music is raw, vibrant and true-to-the-word live. And of course, made for the stage in front of an astonished audience.

Label: Macro / import

item.text: Danish producer and DJ toying with wonky.¬
item.description:
August Fenger is part of the infamous crew surrounding the Danish label Cheff Records, and he's a central figure on the Copenhagen hip hop scene. A Danish music magazine has even called Eloq the Danish capital's own J Dilla.

The Copenhagen producer and DJ has a passion for dusty synths, playstation sounds, helium voices and cut-up drum samples. All in one brew, which gives the challenging fusion of edgy bass music and hip hop rhythms – also known as wonky – a Copenhagen twist.

Label: Cheff

item.text: Mr. Slow Flow from Dilated Peoples.
item.description:
The mainstream audience never gave the new legendary Dilated Peoples the ultimate recognition that the reviews and the respect surrounding them otherwise anticipated. The former graffiti artist Evidence is, on the other hand, the band member with the most successful solo career.

The West Coast rapper from Santa Monica has been given the alias Mr. Slow Flow. His style isn’t snappy but rather laid-back and conversing, which lets you taste every single word of his lyrics as a consequence.

Furthermore, Evidence’s flair for cool productions and his sweetly scented soul atmosphere is more fine-tuned than ever.

Label: Rhymesayers / Target Distribution

item.text: Classic soul from the golden age.
item.description:
He has previously been called Little James Brown. When you experience the sharply dressed soul crooner and cool cat Lee Fields with his funky backing band, The Expressions, you understand why. This is pure soul.

The same brass-gilded mixture that Sharon Jones and Charles Bradley have previously won over the Roskilde audience with. With a huge song catalogue and a 40-year-long experience under the belt, Lee Fields is nevertheless at the peak of his career.

Well-played classic soul from the golden age with swaying hips, lots of love and a guarantee of hot bodies.

item.text: Country folk from the Swedish forests.
item.description:
With their American-sounding country folk, First Aid Kit have come far since their last visit at Roskilde Festival in 2009.

The Söderberg sisters have recorded their latest album The Lion's Roar in Nebraska where Mr. Bright Eyes, Conor Oberst, was so overawed by the girls' vocal harmonies and stage presence that he ended up doing a cameo on the album.

Despite the success and the new experience, the charm and innocence in the two forest elves' music remain intact. With melodic tunes and enchanting voices, the duo sings about the upcoming adulthood with both sweetness and the melancholy inherent in country music.

Here is comfort, support and gilt-edged songs for souls in need.

Label: Wichita / Target Distribution

item.text: Tight, hard electro from upcoming Swedish duo.
item.description:
Fuck Our Ordinary Lives – and start partying!

F.O.O.L. is one of the hottest names in dirty electronic music right now.

Rasmus Hermansen and Oliver Nilsson already have thousands of global hungering fans constantly waiting for the next remix, just as the duo - Sweden's equivalent to Justice? – has toured the globe with their explosive shows.

Tight, neon-coloured electro doesn't get much better than F.O.O.L.

Nils Frahm’s latest record is called Felt, named after the velvet he used to cover up the piano strings in order to avoid waking his neighbours at night when composing his songs. This awareness of sound characterises the German composer and pianist.

From the piano he creates atmospheric and satisfying soundscapes that insist on the attention of every single nerve ending in your ear.

Nils Frahm is a perfect break from pulsating rhythms and howling amplifiers. His music brings forth inner fantasies of walks in majestic landscapes covered in snow and exquisite neo-classicism, all quite far away from the festival.

Label: Erased Tapes / import

item.text: Progressive house from a young Dane signed to deadmau5' label.
item.description:
Frederik Olufsen is the protégé of Canadian house star Deadmau5', signed to his label mau5trap.

Judging from the first tracks – a bass-heavy mix of electro, dubstep and 8-bit – The Frederick sounds ready to give his mouse-masked label boss a race down to the wire.

A new young hope enters the international electronic club scene. With his EP Heavy Crownage and a performance at Roskilde Festival, the young Dane takes his first step towards a career in the company of the big ones.

Label: Mau5trap

Despite the name, Finnish band French Films does not have a special interest in Truffaut or Godard. England – more specifically Manchester – appears to be checked off in their inner music atlas.

In spite of their winter-haunted home, they are not particularly melancholic. Their alternative rock has a youthful appetite for life and a feeling of beach and summer.

French Films are an obvious acquaintance for everyone who is interested in music and wants to have their expectations challenged – and wants to meet a Finnish band that already enjoys international interest.

Label: GAEA / Import

With their blend of Afrobeat and funk with an ethnic flavour, Les Freres Smith is a well-described name at the Paris venues.

The city of lights is a multi-ethnic melting pot with especially many African emigrants, and the Pan-African atmosphere is easy to feel at the brothers' hot concerts, which will probably make Fela Kuti and James Brown high-five in the Hereafter.

If you were at the Kuti sons' multi-funk blast last Roskilde summer on the Arena stage, you're probably hungry for more. Les Freres Smith is at least one of the answers to your prayers.

Label: Comet / import

Piña Colada and Hawaiian shirts go well with Friendly Fires.

The British band has already proven its qualities as a live band on our Odeon stage in 2009. At that time they had found inspiration in Talking Heads and LCD Soundsystem.

On 2011's Pala the sound is more tanned, more tropical, and more umbrellas have been put in the cocktail than before. The starting point is disco, funk and pop. Friendly Fires aim with jubilant enthusiasm for a sexy, electronic stadium sound that reaches out to dancing shoes in the back row.

With dreamy synths, Caribbean flavour and a hardworking front man, Friendly Fires are ready to deliver an undiluted, purely distilled summer party.

Label: XL / Playground

The musical chemistry was apparently present from the beginning with Fritjof & Pikanen. They met to create a remix together and decided to become a duo shortly after.

Fritjof's Swedish-language lyrics revolve around their everyday life, Stockholm and love. With Pikanen’s melodic and effective dubstep arrangements, the music is well suited for both partying and ordinary days.

The general Swedish touch has not prevented the duo from receiving critical acclaim from abroad. Tek 9 - an experienced gentleman in British urban bass music - has already remixed the duo.

Label: EMI

Although he was born far from Kingston Town, Gentleman has captured a large audience with his European hybrid of reggae, dancehall and R&B.

The German-born rasta soul is also appreciated in Jamaica. He has made several trips to the island and won the respect of the country's musicians. At the same time he encourages his large, international audience to remember the reggae genre's message of universal love and diversity.

Gentleman comes to Roskilde with his big band The Evolution as a solid backing.

A sunny summer party filled with rocking riddims, shouts for tolerance and Caribbean flavour awaits.

item.text: Digital, mad ride from former Sugarcubes vocalist.
item.description:
Einar Örn from The Sugarcubes is (at least) just an uncompromising soul as his former band colleague Björk.

After a long musical break, the vocalist now collaborates with sound artist Curver under the moniker Ghostigital.

Ghostigital is a bloody nose to anyone who imagines Iceland as the home of knit sweaters and lovely, ethereal music. A crazy ride over volcanic plains with a sound of industrial, abstract hip hop and disorienting samples. Masterly madness.

Label: Ipecac / import

Charlie Yin enters the electronic scene in great style with Giraffage.

The American's soothing music laps comfortably in a daze of daydreams and melancholy. With warm synthesizers he conjures saltwater-hazy memories of summer holidays in an impressionistic sound as if the music was recorded on analogue cassette tapes years before the young multi-instrumentalist and producers date of birth.

At the same time, the solar-heated, electronic tracks carry enough challenging rhythms and quirky details, making this music for both ears, nostalgia and the mind.

With synths, guitar and effects-drenched, deep vocals, Girlseeker have in their own minimal way made their mark as a new exciting band from the Copenhagen punk underground.

With a no-frills style, Girlseeker inhabits a sound space that is equal parts arrogant, arty post-punk and 80s-kitschy pop taste, perhaps inspired by Americans such as Ariel Pink and John Maus. However, Girlseeker pave their own way with strangely beautiful and gritty synth pop.

Lip-glossed, glamorous disco pop has been a part of Gossip’s sound for long. Even when the trio had rock guitar and leather jackets on the menu. However, the chart-embrace has not been realised as uncompromisingly as on 2012's A Joyful Noise on which pop seems to have taken over after punk.

In this anorexic age of ours, Gossip has a refreshing, iconic front woman in the monumental Beth Ditto. A wonderful voice and a diva as well, who can seduce the audience and sing her lungs out, so that the queen throne of pop ought to be hers pretty soon.

Columbia / Sony Music

Please welcome one of Denmark's new promising names in noisy, experimental math rock.

Governor of Alaska is only two men tall on stage. With guitar and drums they create a tight spectacle filled with quirky rhythms, metallic crust and rumbling, instrumental thunderclaps.

Experimental Afropunk, is how the duo defines the music – the violent beats hit hard when Thor and Hans release the brake and ride towards the stratosphere.

Label: Red Tape

Grieves have recently become part of the alternative hip hop label Rhymesayers, which Slug from Atmosphere was part of founding.

Listening to the 2011album Together/Apart, it is obvious that Grieves belong in this company. Here you find social-realist hip hop, filled with substance abuse, domestic violence and sorry fates.

Budo’s organic production casts a pleasant light over this dark backdrop. The result is a humanistic hip hop sound filled with the pungent flavour of lived life.

Hip hop from a scarred soul with a story to tell – and a must for everyone who witnessed Atmosphere win over Roskilde Festival in 2011.

Label: Rhymesayers / Target Distribution

Geoffrey Gurrumul Yunupingu has already been hailed as one of Australia's – perhaps the world's – most incredible voices.

With an acoustic guitar and his tenor as primary travel companions, the blind aboriginal heads out on musical wanderings through his country's, his clan's and his own history. Brutally beautiful in their melodic and classic simplicity.

Gurrumul's own story has just started on a celebrated chapter. Everyone from Sting to music magazine Rolling Stone have expressed their deep appreciation. However, you shouldn't let this sudden stardust distract you from the deep-rooted and uncorrupted qualities in these gorgeous nature songs.

Label: Dramatico / Playground

New York – especially Queens and Brooklyn – has presented countless legendary hardcore punk bands with a penchant for shouting vocals, fast drumming and metallic riffs.

90s veterans H2O are exponents of the more melodic part of the genre's family tree where the crushing heaviness doesn't exclude a pop hook you can remember after leaving the concert.

Meanwhile, front man Toby Morse is an advocate of the straight-edge lifestyle. Even though the music and the environment is raw you can easily reach far without the use of substances.

Label: Bridge Nine / import

item.text: Arabic trance music with origins back in the golden age of Islam.
item.description:
Every Sunday you can get cured by the music brotherhood of Hamadcha Sufi Tariqa in the Moroccan port town Essaouira.

In the town’s ancient medina the locals gather to obtain a purifying trance by the force of the music or maybe even by the help of Allah. An equivalent magical experience is now taking place at Roskilde Festival.

With their Arabian oboes, exotic major scales and persistent percussion rhythms the Moroccans create a unique space that is both timeless and drags you down through the centuries. The roots of this music reach more than 500 years back in time and are part of the mystic and poetic sufi tradition of Islam.

item.text: Punk'n'country from legendary Hank Williams' grandson.
item.description:
"I'm here to put the dick back in Dixie and the cunt back in country," sings Hank3. The job description is clear for this tattooed cowboy: Nashville's cosy country is going down.

The spirit of grandfather Hank Williams, Johnny Cash and other icons of the rural music is best translated with outlaw punk'n'country, full of beer foam, gunpowder and engine oil.

Hank3's concerts range from classic country with slide guitar, fiddle and banjo to the cowpunk incarnation Hellbilly. Recently, the rebel’s doom/thrash metal band Assjack has even finished the concerts.

Roskilde Festival has courted the maladjusted wretch of country music for a number of years. Hank3 incarnates Nashville after dark, when the well-behaved songwriters have gone to bed.

Label: Target Distribution

The capital of Finland is not the only place where Helsinki Poetry has its starting point. Ebbe Frej and Rune Vigil use different cities around the world as the centre of their songs.

The tour around the world takes place on a magic carpet of pleasant noise – like a more accessible version of My Bloody Valentine, guided by Vigils high vocals.

The mood and choice of colour in the noise-poppy songs vary depending on whether we are in fairytale-like "Marrakech" or rainy "Manchester".

Julia Holter is an acquaintance of the more sophisticated kind, with her inspiration from and references to avant-garde composition music, poetry, art films and theatre.

However, there is still an element of accessible pop music in the many-sided instrumentation of the American’s compositions. The playfulness, the excess of detail and the transitions between anything from synthesizers to cembalo, from beauty to eeriness, is invested in a melodious material that can be related to in countless ways.

Julia Holter creates ambitious avant-garde pop saturated with atmosphere, which rewards the willing and attentive listener to a great degree. Great art is hidden here in outwardly timid music.

Label: RVNG Intl. / import

"I don’t know how to write conventional songs," says Hospitality's lead singer and guitarist Amber Papini in an interview. Good, you’re tempted to say.

The Brooklyn trio's treatment of alternative guitar pop structures is playful and restless without losing any sunshine-blurry, sweet and – you guessed it – hospitable elements.

Laid-back summer nostalgia and edgy details are no opposites with Hospitality. They sing about New York and life as a wage slave on a number of lovely songs that will definitely be appreciated by fans of pop full of melancholy.

Label: Merge / Import

item.text: Dramatic songs in minor from a dark mind.
item.description:
Madrugada was one of Norway's biggest rock bands. Back in the band’s heyday, you really paid attention to vocalist Sivert Høyem’s baritone that made you think of a Norwegian cousin of Nick Cave or Michael Stipe from R.E.M.

Høyem still produces grandiose Scandinavian rock full of inner drama. On the Norwegian’s fourth album, Long Slow Distance, he has found inspiration in surprising places (Høyem mentions German kraut rock and French pop as some of them), and the synthesizer often knocks on the door in Høyem’s stormy songs in minor.

Label: Hektor Grammofon / EMI

item.text: Grandiose pop rock with solid melodies.
item.description:
Church of the Real, is the title of I Got You On Tape's new album. Grandiose and self-assured – just like the music.

With a sporadic disco inspiration, church organ and catchy choruses, the well-playing four-piece ensures an even more grandiose atmosphere than ever before.

Jacob Bellens' authoritative voice is just one of many aces up the sleeve with this band. Relaxed and unforced they deliver poppy rock songs that seizes the key to the audience's beating heart.

I Got You On Tape retakes Roskilde Festival as a band that risen significantly from the ranks. The Danes are well on their way to becoming central on the Nordic alternative scene.

Label: Tigerspring / Universal

You can almost hear it in the name. Icona Pop aims to create chic, sophisticated electro pop songs.

The photogenic duo with the honey-like voices attracted all kinds of buzz in the blogosphere with the EP Nights Like This, which is rich on crystalline pop, bubbling synths and catchy choruses.

Icona Pop might become Scandinavia's next pop sensation in the tradition of Robyn, Annie and even Ace of Base.

Forget all about bloody scalps. Copenhagen-based Indians will steal lots of beating hearts.

The mysterious band played its first concert in February. In one of few, scarce messages to the outside world, Indians describe the music as magical, dreamy and poetic.

Indians' songs overflow with psychedelic beauty in widescreen. The first smoke signals suggest a band with a laid-back ease of writing alternative pop hymns.

Label: TWIMM / Playground

He is tipped to be one of the future stars of the global music scene.

With the praised debut album Northern Light Gambian Night, Dawda Jobarteh combines virtuoso kora harp playing with a sensibility that is both Nordic and jazzy –most likely a product of many years as a resident in Copenhagen where he has played with many of very best musicians from the Nordic jazz scene.

With Dawda Jobarteh, Pavilion Junior gets a different, extra sunny glow.

Label: Sterns

It's easy to be a little jealous of the Swedes. Nobody can make pop like them.

Take Jonathan Johansson, Sweden's new champion in romantic and soulful pop. With his Swedish lyrics and tasteful 80s-leaning arrangements, Johansson has also conquered pop hearts all the way across the Atlantic. He stylishly and coolly distills romance and soul into black shiny pop songs, making both fans of Depeche Mode and New Order cheer.

Jonathan Johansson continues the Swedish tradition of writing superior, slightly melancholic pop songs.

Label: Hybris / A:larm

For practically a lifetime, Jupiter Bokondji has worked hard to show how the ethnic diversity in DR Congo can result in something other than civil war.

Okwess International is a band of talented young people from the provinces in the war-ravaged country. Together, they play adventurous sunshine pop with the healing zebola dance as a starting point.

With Jupiter – "the rebels' general" – in front, the well-playing band tells the story of a Congo that doesn't rhyme with distress, drought and death. Jupiter & Okwess International provides access to a golden palace of music where funk, party and guitar tones rule.

Label: All Other / import

item.text: Figurehead of the Berlin techno scene.
item.description:
Over the past 15 years, he has steadily been promoted to the genre's premier league. Today, Paul Kalkbrenner's name is written in big letters at explosive, electronic parties throughout Europe.

Kalkbrenner's dream of creating his own danceable techno started in the 90s on Berlin's hot dance floors. However, things didn't really take off until the 00s.

Since the job of soundtrack composer and leading actor in the cult film Berlin Calling, Paul Kalkbrenner has become some kind of figurehead for the Berlin techno scene. The 2011 album Icke Wieder cements the German's talent for creating beautiful and harmonious minimal techno.

Now the Berliner beats move to Roskilde Festival. Brace yourself for an electronic party in widescreen, which will probably put the German in the company of former Roskilde conquerors such as Trentemøller and Tiësto.

Label: Paul Kalkbrenner Musik / VME

”Although you belong in the dark below, you can easily rise and shine quickly,” we wrote in 2010 when Kellermensch had transformed from Pavilion Junior pupa in 2009 to a pitch-black butterfly.

These words also hold true in 2012 when the band is winning new fans over – internationally as well – with their hard-hitting rock filled with crushing guitars, clenched fists and melodic tastiness.

The Danes inhabit an existentialistic knocked-over space where metal, Russian literature and alternative rock naturally form a part of the same formula.

We welcome back Kellermensch who now inhabit the top floor of Danish rock.

Label: Universal

item.text: Copenhagen’s bad boy of hip hop.
item.description:
With grainy YouTube videos and lots of ghetto attitude, Kesi and his crew have been part of setting the agenda for Danish hip hop.

On their own, these young troublemakers have created some of the most raw and lively rap heard in the kingdom. The language is Danish through and through. Musically, they are especially inspired by English grime hip hop’s scratchy sound.

With Benny Jamz’ pounding productions as a toxic background, Kesi is a must if you want get an impression of ​​Danish hip hop anno 2012.

Label: Universal

In a bright green collision of impressions, smells and ideas, Dr. Lazerlyde from Danish band Analogik puts together sound bits, string riffs and samples, which sounds af if they are taken from Bollywood, Nintendo, London's deepest club basements and old radio programmes.

On top of this mix, Khal Allan delivers thoughtful, baroque rap lyrics, which have given him a unique status in the Danish hip hop underground.

A brilliant word juggler has found a companion who can give him the right backing.

Life at Copenhagen bars and takeaway joints now has a perfect soundtrack with Klumben & Raske Penge, who raps about life in their hometown in a mixture of Jamaican, sun-drenched grooves and Danish social realism.

The two dancehall darlings are everywhere on the radio and online with the single "Rundt". The track proves how easily you can philosophise about life and big ideas while going grocery shopping around the corner.

Danish dancehall rarely sounds better than this.

Label: Cheff Records / Kontrafon

Norway has a new electro pop princess. Her name is Sandra Kolstad and she has an almost absurdly firm grip on producing frosty, electronic pop.

Norwegian critics have already fallen in love with Kolstad's futuristic robot disco, which may very well soon catapult the Norwegian towards international fame.

Kolstad's music is sophisticated and artistically ambitious but also with hooks and choruses, which are just waiting to take permanent residence in your brain.

Label: Trust Me / import

Daydreaming about a gorgeous tropical island is hardly unusual in the windswept Scandinavia.

Korallreven has translated the longing for the azure horizon and the gentle sway of fan palms to electronic, semi-instrumental dream pop.

Marcus Joons was in Samoa when the idea for the project arose. Together with his friend Daniel Tjäder he has long since taken blogs and international music media.

The mission is coconut-scented, tropically yearning songs where your ears are bathed in nostalgic synths, Caribbean rhythms and soothing female voices.

Korallreven is a perfect journey south without double bookings, noisy tourists or disappointing weather forecasts.

Label: Acéphale / A:larm

With a firm grip on melodic, alternative rock, Kraftklub has charmed the rock-loving audience in Europe's most populous nation.

Lead singer Felix Brummer’s sparklingly witty, German-language lyrics crawl over a soundtrack that sounds a bit like Franz Ferdinand or The Clash with weißbier in the blood and thinly disguised chart ambitions.

Many kilometers south of Berlin, Kraftklub have created their own intelligent and party-like rebel music. The southern German musketeers like to wear college jackets, belts and polo shirts when they skewer the metropolitan bourgeoisie.

Universal

item.artistName: ALISON KRAUSS & UNION STATION feat. JERRY DOUGLAS
item.description:
Having spent over 25 years in the business and won just as many Grammys, bluegrass queen Alison Krauss is a relaxed, unpretentious legend, only in her early 40s.

The North American belle brings really good company. The honoured Dobro guitarist Jerry Douglas helps her conquer the Roskilde stage, and the rustic band Union Station includes Dan Tyminski who did George Clooney's singing voice in O Brother, Where Art Thou?

Alison Krauss' lavish voice makes every song from her lips a true delight. Even if the subjects are typically about heartache and endless sorrow, there is always a twinkle in her eye between the banjo and fiddle sounds.

Label: Rounder / Universal

Drum, bass and saxophone distorted beyond recognition is not the most obvious setup for dystopian rock'n'roll. Nevertheless, Kriget creates a very distinct expression due to this rather unusual instrumental trio.

The three Swedes' mechanical, pared-down but also playful free-form jazz often have references to Germans such as Peter Brötzmann and D.A.F.

But one of the best things about this music is its immediacy. Kriget can deliver a thunderclap that will shake your head. Get ready for some instrumental future music that is rawer and more to the bone than an x-ray.

Label: EMI Sweden / Import

Copenhagen's electronic scene and Iceland's lush nature melt together like neon-coloured lava when Kúra is playing.

Child of nature Fanney Ósk Thórisdóttirs's voice rests on the chilled, rumbling electronic production (guitarist and programmer Rasmus Liebst is the trio's Danish member), which is the epitome of big city melancholy from the nightclubs' lower floors – an inspiration could be UK band Everything But The Girl.

Kúra's sound is a tempting, Nordic darkness.

Label: Nordic Music Society / VME

Torsten Larsen and his squires ought to be mentioned when looking up the term 'critic's favourite' in a Danish dictionary.

With a solid grasp on songwriting, Larsen & Furious Jane have created a handful of albums that uses well-written, absolutely non-Danish sounding indie rock to explore the rather disgruntled mood as it sounds coming from a group of Danes.

It's sensitive, subtle and purged of stadium rock manners. An obvious acquaintance for fans of The Walkmen and other bitter-about-life male bands. Larsen & Furious Jane's days as a well-kept secret should be over soon. As long as Torsten Larsen promises not to give up the dark outlook, which lights up on each of the band's releases.

Tip: the band gives away their two latest albums Zen Sucker and Dolly as downloads on momowave.org

item.text: The Danish grime scene's new crown princess.
item.description:
The crown princess on the Danish grime scene is called Linkoban. This sharp, new acquaintance ensures that Lucy Love is not the only Danish female representative of the rap genre originating from the UK.

Linkoban's show draws on Japanese horror in the vein of The Ring and The Grudge. Her first track "Like This" suggests a new exciting acquaintance for anyone with a penchant for dirty urban pop that makes Copenhagen rhyme with London.

Label: Superbillion / Playground

In the more conservative (black) metal circles, Brooklyn’s Liturgy has created controversies by means of their every-day appearances and undergraduate mindset. However, in spite of their appearances, the music is still none the less scathing and chaotic.

Liturgy’s black metal overflows with the biting cold of an ice winter that makes your legs tremble and leaves your mouth dry.

Hunter Hunt-Hendrix’ unnatural screaming vocals are dishearteningly like a howling homeless whirlwind. The founder’s abuse of both guitar and vocal cords is matched by a band that unites the genre’s primal scream with an instrumental equilibrism you mostly encounter in jazz, mathrock and modern music compositions.

Label: Thrill Jockey / VME

On a dense stream of albums, Matt "Lone" Cutler has developed his own imaginative mix of rave, hip hop, funk, techno and star-glittering synthesizers.

The clubby party sensation has recently been upgraded. At the same time, the Brit’s experimental approach toys with the typical dance floor beat and creates a memorable experience. Even for those who prefer not to shake a leg.

It’s evident on the critically acclaimed 2012 release Galaxy Gardens on which the many flavours, colours and shades are perfectly balanced atop the looped rhythms.

Magic Wire / import

Old US flags wave over The Low Anthem’s rustic songs.

The band had a minor breakthrough with Oh My God, Charlie Darwin, which made a larger audience discover the Providence band’s richly orchestrated blend of rhythm & blues, country, blues rock and pastoral folk.

On 2011's Smart Flesh the band sounds more subdued than before. This rule has exceptions, however, for instance with the 9-11 rock hymn "Boeing 737".

The Low Anthem place themselves confidently on the mountain peaks of the American rock tradition. Their songs are full of lofty solitude, campfires and fresh mountain air.

Label: Bella Union / Cooperative

Finally, we have M83 back at Roskilde Festival to bathe our ears in grandiose sci-fi sounds.

Anthony Gonzalez’ latest magnum opus – the double album Hurry Up, We’re Dreaming – makes M83's previous releases sound rustic and simple.

80s-happy synths and bombastic noise rock float in an upward maelstrom with the Milky Way's outer provinces as the final destination – like keyboard whiz Jean-Michel Jarre would have sounded if he were backed by My Bloody Valentine.

M83 has delivered one of the ultimate dreamy soundtracks of this millennium. Over the top – and damn proud of it.

Label: Naïve / Playground

item.text: Upbeat hip hop with pop flavour.
item.description:
In the time of mixtapes and with the use of Twitter, Mac Miller has conquered the young hip hop scene just like his bro Wiz Khalifa.

With his debut album Blue Slide Park this white kid has achieved such high sales numbers that his name is now molded in solid gold. Already before the album was released, Mac Miller's live shows experienced massive interest, also in the Nordic countries.

Mac Miller’s light and often bubbly hip hop is packed with summer vibes as well as thoughts and dreams of girls and fame. Carefree and with a positive aura this pride of Pittsburgh aims for an even greater entourage.

Label: Rostrum / Import

”Let freedom ring with the shotgun blast!”

Many metal fans probably still goosebumps when they hear this call from Machine Head’s debut album Burn My Eyes.

Machine Head have crushed their way through the 90s and 00s with a metal sound that is both varied and brutal. On stage it is equally clear that Rob Flynn is a friend of the metal people – many probably remembers Machine Head’s raw Roskilde concert in 2007.

The Californian heroes have become exponents of progressive, melodic thrash metal that will never rest until all fists are in the air.

Label: Roadrunner / Warner

Seattle's hiphop mascot is no longer called Sir Mix-A-Lot. Macklemore is the name in 2012. At home he is close to owning the keys to the city, and the rest of America is also about to catch up on the white rapper's genuine hip hop.

The Seattle hero sends an erect middle finger to the conservative souls of the genre. Here you get to hear samples from The Killers and Red Hot Chili Peppers, a showdown with Nike in "Wings" and tribute songs to something as un-hip hop a sport as baseball.

With producer and beat smith Ryan Lewis aboard, Macklemore treats us with different emotional hip hop that can hijack many hearts – even outside of hip hop circles.

This Danish band enjoys great popularity in their home country. And the fan base continues to grow when they deliver their catchy, straight-from-the-pub rock that skillfully channels 70s protest rock, from Danish favourites Gasolin' to The Clash.

The 2011 album Imperiet falder portrays a society on a collision course, but with Johan Olsen's empathic and powerful vocals at the centre you always feel safe and in good hands.

Magtens Korridorer delivers efficient, Danish-language rock you almost can sing along to, even without knowing the Danish language.

Label: Universal

item.text: Alien wedding music from the mountain village of Galicnik.
item.description:
Galicnik in western Macedonia has its own summer festival. Each year during the festival, a particularly lucky couple are married during a Galicka wedding – a ceremonious event, which includes the entire mountain village.

This ceremony is accompanied by a unique form of wedding music, an almost trance-like sound played on a zurla – a kind of obo with the same sound as bagpipes – and giant tapan drums.

Majovci Group’s music and band members are direct descendants of this tradition, which dates back more than a thousand years. With this fascinating dance orchestra, you’ll get an exotic breath of air from Eastern Europe’s colourful past.

Hail the Danish hip hop heroes. Malk De Koijn’s nearly-legendary ‘we’re back, did you miss us’ concert at Roskilde Festival in 2009 was a true triumph that could stand alongside the greatest moments in over 40 years of festival history.

The ‘welcome back’ roar will reverberate in 2012 when the Danish hip hop darlings deliver a new show at one of their absolute favourite playgrounds.

Malk De Koijn fearlessly skips about in the hip hop genre and the Danish language, making neither look like itself. And with a new raving classic out, Toback to the Fromtime, everything suggests that 2012 will be another landmark year for this trio of sharp-tongued super men.

Label: Langestrand Fladhjul / Target Distribution

item.text: Challenging mix of dubstep, techno and house.
item.description:
Martyn was originally regarded as a promising name in bass-heavy dubstep. Today, the Dutch producer and DJ sounds more like a type that will not put up with a single musical label.

Dubstep, techno, UK funky and drum'n'bass intersect in a transatlantic genre fusion where Detroit, London, Chicago and Berlin are just some of the electronic metropolises popping out.

Martyn is the right choice for anyone desiring a dance party full of vitamins.

Label: Brainfeeder / import

Robert Dinero, Uffie Ice and Money Mats Norman constitute Mash Up International, one of the hottest names on the Scandinavian club scene right now.

Like Roskilde Festival, they mix music from far and near, and even farther. The DJ and producer group mentions kuduro, baile funk, cumbia, dancehall and kwaito as some of the points of references.

With Gnucci Banana as a vocalist in tiger stripes, they have given Miike Snow's "Animal" new life. A remix like this is a good example of the colourful mood and the humor that the three Swedes use to conquer the club scenes.

item.text: Elevated noise rock with melodious warmth.
item.description:
When a band names its second album after itself, it often indicates that the members have found the quintessence of their sound. It is indeed the case for The Megaphonic Thrift.

The Norwegian four-piece has taken giant strides forward since 2009 when they released promising noisy tones and played on our Pavilion Junior stage.

With the second album, these Norwegians have slit a crack in the universe from where melodious noise rock with an often psychedelic edge flows.

At the same time, the band is able to write concise melodies. The New Yorker-cool, and slightly exhausted, male voice of Richard Myklebust is challenged by the angel-like, ethereal female voice of Linn Frøkedal.

Label: Tuba / Pad and Pen

Few Danish bands have had as great success home and abroad as Mew.

Mew has developed a unique sound where Jonas Bjerre's choirboy vocals are the human anchor point in a tornado of sophisticated, dreamy, often hard-hitting rock. Amidst these rugged sounds the band has even written some catchy-as-ever choruses that make even pop fans cherish this band.

Mew's concert at Roskilde Festival 2012 is one of very few played this this summer. A unique chance of a reunion with an Roskilde favorite – perhaps even with treats from their upcoming album.

Label: Evil Office / A:larm

The live performance is the most holy call for Modeselektor.

After having been brought up in the restriction-rich DDR, the partnership Gernot Bronsert and Sebastian Szary constantly tear down mental Berlin walls with their bubbly musical alchemy consisting of equal amounts of techno, hip hop, IDM, UK bass, crunk and countless other genres.

The borderline schizophrenic, almost epilepsy-inducing style changes and the totally crazy party are drawn with bright-coloured spray paint across the modus operandi of Modeselektor.

A concert with these two Germans is a life-affirming celebration of the inexhaustible potential of music and the shudder of the body when a really deep bass thunders.

Label: Monkeytown / VME

item.text: Alternative R&B princess returns to Roskilde.
item.description:
On rare occassions, Roskilde Festival introduces the same artist two years in a row. Sometimes, however, we are happily forced to make exceptions.

Janelle Monáe's Roskilde debut in a packed Cosmopol tent last year was a dizzying triumph, which demonstrated how memorable Roskilde history is written year after year. We can hardly wait to reexperience this great talent.

Janelle Monáe combines futuristic soul, R&B, hip hop and rock in a show, which is a treat for both androids, dancing girls and music-snobbish lads.

In 2012 it will be even bigger and with a new batch of songs loaded in the spaceship.

Label: Bad Boy / Warner

With his mildly psychedelic, eccentric pop music, R. Stevie Moore could have been part of the same royal line as Van Dyke Parks, Frank Zappa and Kevin Ayers.

Instead he has chosen to record his more than 400 highly varied releases at home and earned a minor (read: way too small) name as the spiritual ancestor of modern DIY artists such as Guided By Voices and Ariel Pink.

Having spent a lifetime as the secret idol of various alternative rock bands, this silver-grey underground legend is finally ready for some spotlight.

R. Stevie Moore is "the godfather of home recording" – an independent, overlooked original whom the zeitgeist is slowly catching up on.

Label: Cherry Red / import

Drums are useful as more than just a rhythmic backbone.

Since childhood, Mohammad Reza Mortazavi has been remarkably talented with the Persian handheld drum known as the tombak. With shimmering strokes and finger techniques, the Iranian creates a new world of sounds and effects. Delicate and refined but so massive and explosively talented that you almost feel tempted to pinch your arm.

Mortazavi conjures up an almost narrative thread with his simple instrument and puts any theories about the limited capabilities of the drum to shame.

Label: Flowfish / import

Do you like your guitar rock progressive, hard-hitting and technical? Like, for instance, At the Drive-In, The Mars Volta and similar intelligent rock bands?
