In that case, we just may have your new favourite band playing at Roskilde 2012. Mutiny On The Bounty rips your heart out with some tearing post-hardcore.

It's not just well-executed and with more ideas in one song than many bands use on an entire album. It is also brutally beautiful, melodic guitar rock that will appeal to everyone who digs music with both balls and brain.

Label: Redfield / Import

Roskilde Festival is – as a longstanding home of extreme metal – naturally included on Nasum’s farewell tour.

The Swedish band is responsible for some of the most exquisite musical punishments of the fast grindcore genre. Their music is more churning and sickening than a series of graphic chainsaw massacres. The often ultra-short sonic attacks have made Nasum one of the genre's finest.

The band's vocalist Mieszko Talarczyk died during the tsunami in 2004. Keijo Niinimaa from the grind mates Rotten Sound now delivers the vocals instead.

As they emphasise themselves: this is no corny reunion. Just a worthy farewell from a recognised grind band that will leave a smoking black hole in the middle of the genre map.

Label: Relapse / Cosmos Music Group

Nelson Can plays rough, tearing post-punk. "Spontaneously, not so much bullshit," they say themselves.

The all-female band consists of Signe, Selina and Tami who has released the catchy whistle single "Apple Pie" and taken the first step toward a wider audience.

Get ready for loud songs filled with attitude and lots of exclamation points but also poppy sweetness and powerful girl charm in the sparsely arranged songs.

Niki & The Dove from Stockholm have already made ​​a big impression outside of Scandinavia with their opulent synth pop.

Malin Dahlström’s vocals with the thick Swedish accent are cold and chic. Gustaf Karlöf’s swarming arrangements are both compact, sophisticated and the perfect backdrop for the duo's melodic songs.

Niki & The Dove are a duo on the way up, and they may very well be the scoop of the year for anyone who enjoys the likes of Björk, The Knife or Oh Land.

The duo's live shows are known to be spectacular extravaganzas where the two Swedes’ theatric past doesn’t really shows.

Label: Sub Pop / Universal

With his face hidden in dark shadows and a series of YouTube hits, Niklas has become one of today's hottest, totally home-grown pop acts.

The mysterious, Swedish-raised rapper and pop singer does not show his face in any of his videos. Still it's clear that Niklas has a remarkable talent for creating hits full of Danish-language rap, syrupy sweet synths, 90s disco and power-flirtatious funk attitude.

Lasse Buhl and Troels B-Knudsen are proud children of the environment surrounding the Copenhagen venue Culture Box – a Danish, if not Nordic, epicentre of techno and electronic music.

With an original starting point on the drum'n'bass scene, the lads have delved into more straightforward techno. The duo's Nordic sound has been so convincing that the, in techno circles, semi-legendary label Sonic Groove has invited them into their fold.

Northern Structures are a good example of the fact that Copenhagen can compare with techno capitals such as Berlin and Detroit.

Label: Sonic Groove

item.artistName: OF THE WAND AND THE MOON
item.description:
European dark folk or neo-folk is with its minor chords, march rhythms and melancholic vision not a genre that gets much attention.

One of the most prominent bands of the darkened, cultural-pessimistic genre is Of The Wand And The Moon.

The Lone Descent from 2011 frames the mood of an occult mass deep inside a North European forest lit up by torches. But according to the musical mastermind, inspiration is also found in 60s icons such as Lee Hazlewood and Serge Gainsbourg.

Of The Wand And The Moon is beautiful doom music filled with catchy melodies and dark atmosphere.

Label: Heidrunar Myrkrunar / VME

With a number of challenging releases – most recently Replica, based on samples from old TV ads – Daniel Lopatin has placed his curious nickname centrally on the experimental, progressive electronica scene.

Using samples, effects, loops and synths, the Brooklyn-based composer/producer flips, bends, pushes and curls his piled-up musical structures out of shape and focus until cosmos and chaos blend together.

Oneohtrix Point Never is a hefty sound bombardment filled with colours, dark acid, earthquaking vibrations and ideas.

Label: Editions Mego / Cooperative

item.text: Modern tango played by young men with a revolutionary spark.
item.description:
The 12-piece Orquesta Típica Fernández Fierro has given the lifeblood-dripping tango a revolutionary update and is hitting the spot in Argentina as well as the rest of the world.

Here's a rare chance to experience swelling emotions, sensual glow and the classical 2/4 time of tango by a group of casually clad tangueros who grab the tango genre by the throat with a ferocious and punk-like attitude.

Experience the drama of tango, unrefined beauty and poetry, which could not have been made at any other time in history – fresh from the streets of Buenos Aires.

The traditional songs of Kenya are given a gleam of today’s London with Owiny Sigoma Band.

In 2009, a group of London-based lads (their resumé includes the art-funk band Elmore Judd and Gorillaz) went to Nairobi to jam with the local musicians, originating in the traditions of the Luo people. The result was so appealing and funky that the influential world music pusher, DJ and radio host Gilles Peterson signed the band.

The focal point of the music is a special Kenyan harp called the nyatiti. The English musicians spar attentively, humbly and instinctively with the Africans’ hypnotic music.

Label: Brownswood / import

item.text: Festive and intelligent dance pop with lots of positive vibes.
item.description:
Chris Glover is not likely to be grateful for the financial crisis (who is, anyway?) but his single "Don't Fuck With My Money" hardly could have come out at a better time.

Penguin Prison, Glover's mysterious alias, didn't just hit the spirit of the times spot on with this single. The New Yorker specialises in bubbly, positive, intelligent, hipster-approved party music with equal tastes of Hot Chip, Daft Punk and Justin Timberlake.

Despite the single, Penguin Prison remains the perfect cure for you if you want to party, flirt, dance and forget financial troubles for a while.

Label: Stranger / import

A melancholic voice and a battered piano are the starting point.

Perfume Genius digs the simple set-up, and it's hard not to get sucked into Mike Hadreas’ universe of simple minor chords and shattered destinies.

The bright angelic voice from Seattle writes piano ballads so beautiful and winged that you almost see the ill-fated characters from the songs walk past you. The new album Put Your Back N 2 It is even more direct in its choice of subject than its predecessor – it often touches upon homosexual love, addiction and suicide.

Perfume Genius is almost shockingly direct in his lyrics, and the music is filled with wonderful melancholy.

Label: Matador / Playground

"El Rebelde del Acordeón", "El Rey de la Cumbia Colombiana". Celso Piña enjoys many honourable nicknames in the Spanish-speaking world.

The Mexican veteran is one of the main architects behind the cumbia genre's renaissance in Latin America. In recent years, the tropical sunshine music has also provided the basis for countless fiestas at Roskilde Festival.

Piña gives the old Colombian genre an electronic touch while incorporating everything from ska to rap in his urban, groundbreaking sound.

Label: La Tuna / import

item.artistName: KIMMO POHJONEN / SAMULI KOSMINEN and PROTON STRING QUARTET
item.text: Futuristic music for accordion, strings and samples.
item.description:
Known to many as the Jimi Hendrix of the accordion, Kimmo Pohjonen transforms the mariner’s instrument of choice into an avant-garde contraption from the future.

With an experienced group of strings and sample/percussion magician Samuli Kosminen behind him, the energetic front man creates a cross-dressing total experience that is equal parts modern compositions, manipulated electronics and strange art rock.

Samples, loops and classical strings are elegantly united with Pohjonen’s ecstatic and crude grip on the accordion.

A trippy experience for all musical daredevils who like to travel far from the mainland of music.

Label: Ondine / import

We have a treat for fans of brostep, mashup, glitchhop – or the musical language-impaired who simply needs a ride in the genre carousel where the mirror ball is always spinning and the seasick hip hop beats just continue.

Pretty Lights make the dance floor sizzle with his visuals-marinated shows where Derek Vincent Smith from his laptop creates a psychedelic party full of 2012 sensation, acidy cut-ups, recycled chorus fragments, mutated dubstep and lazer-cut beats.

Following the tradition of DJ Shadow, Pretty Lights shows how to steal left, right and centre while still mixing his own, radioactively luminous brew.

Label: Pretty Lights Music

According to music legend T Bone Burnett, Chris Thile – frontman and mandolin visionary in Punch Brothers – may very well be to bluegrass music what Louis Armstrong was to jazz.

With their banjo, guitar, mandolin, fiddle and upright bass, Punch Brothers may look like your classic homegrown bluegrass band. But this quintet is undeniably contemporary, and their folk sound doesn’t prevent them from flirting intensively with jazz, pop and alternative rock.

Experience yourself why Punch Brothers are being called the future of bluegrass by the good people of Memphis, the stronghold of this traditional and authentic genre.

Label: Nonesuch / Warner

Lee Ranaldo has been a core member of genre-defining noise rock band Sonic Youth for 30 years. The band is now on hiatus, and it has given Ranaldo time to complete his solo project, which was started back in 2010.

As a guitarist Ranaldo has been at the intersection between experimental minimalism and alternative rock. He recently released his first song-oriented solo album Between The Times And The Tides.

Together with Sonic Youth drummer Steve Shelley and Alan Licht, among others, he has built on a musical universe based on classic, alternative rock. No radio-friendly songs here, but an obvious joy of playing the music he does best.

Label: Matador / Playground

item.text: Dark baritone pop mixed with experimental electronica.
item.description:
Under the name of Rangleklods, Esben Andersen leads the way between organic songwriting and the electronic music’s cooler universe.

On the debut album Beekeeper, Rangleklods demonstrates how to create dark-edged, melodious baritone pop using the computer’s musical platform. Techno, trip hop, IDM and many other more synthetic genres flow constantly in the underground of this artist's universe.

The electronic sophistication is only one side of the coin with Rangleklods whose music is made just as much for the stage as for laptop in the bedroom.

Label: Sound of Copenhagen / A:larm

The members of Oregon's perhaps most beer-thirsty hard rock band all have a past in a variety of lesser-known outfits. With Red Fang they believe they have found the ultimate goal of their many years in the holy service of the riff.

The 2011 album Murder The Mountains gives good insight into what awaits Roskilde Festival’s hordes of hops-hungry rock fans this summer: a testosterone-driven update of Black Sabbath, Melvins and Kyuss. A party for everyone convinced that The Lord not only has a long beard but also a checkered shirt, a spiked belt and a can of beer in his hand.

Label: Relapse / Cosmos Music Group

Nordic, heavy and depressive are in some contexts almost synonymous.

This is definitely the case with Redwood Hill – a new razor-sharp five-piece from Copenhagen who thunders with post-metal of the both minor chord-melodious and brutal kind.

Redwood Hill, who's releasing the debut album in 2012, is a promising acquaintance for fans of intelligent metal and Scandinavian dark-mindedness.

The Shape Of Punk To Come – one of the hardcore genre's undisputed masterpieces – resulted in Refused splitting up while this hand grenade of an album cemented their status as a central and widely influencing band.

Now the Swedes make up for lost time. Fans of metal, punk and (post-)hardcore have gaped at the chance of experiencing this favourite band on stage where they, reportedly, are even more intense than on album.

We are looking forward to delighting both old and new fans with high-level hardcore. Packed with rhythmic complexity, daring and violent kamikaze attacks on everything conformist in this world.

Label: Epitaph / Cosmos Music Group

In a matter of short time, Rockwell has become one of the most wanted artists on the drum'n'bass scene – with bookings at both the London bass temple Fabric and wherever the music is playing hard and hot in Saint Petersburg.

Rockwell has a distinct flair of making the dance floor boil over with his fierce beats. And according to an interview, the Brit spends months working on all the intricate details on a single track.

Rockwell is predicted to be one of the next big acts by anyone with just the slightest sense of drum'n'bass. Show up while you still have a chance to see him from the front row.

Label: Shogun Audio / import

item.text: Organic hip hop with a politically beating heart.
item.description:
Many people call The Roots the best live band of hip hop for their swing and rock band feeling. Deservedly so.

The hard-working hip hop collective from Philadelphia make their instruments glow and sound just as organic and authentic as a crackling vinyl record.

?uestlove, Black Thought and co lead the way when it comes to hip hop packed with hot neo-soul, social indignation, humour, funk and improv-minded jazz.

The Roots rarely visits Europe nowadays, and they play at Roskilde Festival exclusively in Scandinavia.

Label: Def Jam / Universal

item.artistName: CHRISTINA ROSENVINGE feat. CHRIS BROKAW & REFREE
item.text: Spanish singer accompanied by Mr. Sadcore himself.
item.description:
In the course of three decades as a performing artist, Christina Rosenvinge has become an experience artist who has progressed from teenage pop idol to a respected alternative artist in Spain.

Her characteristic vocals are reminiscent of both Stina Nordenstam and Cat Power. She has a loyal audience in Spain but has never performed up North.

For this unique, first concert in Denmark, she is accompanied by sadcore legend Chris Brokaw of Codeine and the Catalan troubadour Refree.

Warner Music Spain / import

item.text: Lyrical pop revolving around a fantastic voice.
item.description:
Timothée Régnier’s passport may be French but his history indicates why his stage name “Rover” isn’t a coincidence.

Returned from Lebanon, Rover spent a whole stormy winter, like another Bon Iver, writing and instrumentating songs in a dilapidated house.

Rover has already mesmerised fans of lyrical pop in France with his fantastic voice, which has been compared to Anthony Hegarty’s.

When singing, the well-travelled Frenchman’s English is practically flawless and can be traced back to his childhood years in New York.

Rover’s first full album is on its way in 2012.

Label: Wagram / Target Distribution

item.text: The unsung master of Detroit hip hop.
item.description:
He has shared the stage with Eminem in the duo Bad Meets Evil, worked as ghost writer for Dr. Dre and is part of the super group Slaughterhouse. Yet, Royce Da 5’9” has only made a name for himself in narrow circles.

With the comeback album Success Is Certain he stages the big breakthrough. Here the experienced rapper authoritatively puts his skills as a MC on display.

After some turbulent years, Ryan Montgomery is ready to take the stage and prove why he is one of America's undeservedly overlooked rappers.

Come and witness a true hip hop resurrection. The time has come.

Shady / Universal

Danish-language rock thrives these days. Take Rum 37, for instance, who plays wistful guitar rock with echoes of other Scandinavian-tongued bands such as Kent and Love Shop.

The band's first EP demonstrates a firm grasp of the Nordic, blue-toned songwriting tradition.

Kristian Helmuth sings with intensity about his Copenhagen, the fluidity of life and the sun that burns a hole in the dark clouds.

item.text: Protest hip hop from white pioneer.
item.description:
With his literary aura and often political choice of topic, Sage Francis is far from the hip hop mainstream.

The indie rapper from Rhode Island has, if anybody, been one of the pioneers when it comes to weaken the distinction between alternative rock, poetry slam and hip hop.

On the latest album Li(f)e, the protest hip hopper raps on top of an instrumental backing that has more in common with swampy, white roots rock than chocolate-brown soul or R&B. Particularly organised religion gets a clout on the head, but Francis’ well-told stories don’t spare himself.

Sage Francis rarely plays live nowadays. Don’t miss a rapper who knows his Bob Dylan and Tom Waits as well as his Public Enemy.

Label: Strange Famous / import

As far back as in 2008, Roskilde Festival had its eye on Santigold who with great self-confidence treated the audience at the Cosmopol stage with her chic mix of R&B, dub, new wave and hyperurban pop.

Now the follow-up to her debut album is finally on its way, and judging from the reception of her current single, the mainstream audience has missed her as much as we have. The catchy tune “Disparate Youth” seems to have become one of the defining tunes of 2012 already.

Santigold is one-of-a-kind and a style icon in the vein of Karen O and M.I.A., and we are proud to present this hot, entertaining artist for the second time at this early point in her, most likely, long career.

Label: Atlantic / Warner

18-year-old Mathilde Savery has made quite an impression with a minimum of means. With a strong, personal voice and a firm grip around her acoustic guitar, the young singer has already captured her first hearts. Many more await ahead.

Mathilde Savery sounds confident and determined to bring her folk songs out to a big audience. This year she enters the studio to record her debut album.

item.text: The alternative pop princes are back.
item.description:
It's been five years since The Shins last played at Roskilde Festival. In 2012, James Mercer's band rises again with new band members – and probably with a few tricks from Broken Bells, Mercer's collaboration with Danger Mouse.

The Shins play sunshine-filled guitar pop with gilt-edged tunes, a little eccentricity and self-destructive attitude. At the same time, the band's new incarnation seems more comfortable in the stadium spotlight than before.

The Shins are not just an underground band that has overtaken many mainstream bands. The American band is also an educational acquaintance for older festival-goers who think that no one writes songs like Paul McCartney and Brian Wilson nowadays.

item.text: Garage rock with leather jacket and shades.
item.description:
Shiny leather jacket darkness permeates everything when Shiny Darkly turns on the amplifiers.

With a well-developed understanding of classic, dirty garage rock riffs, these three young lads have already – on a basis of few exquisite songs – convinced the Danish music press, the picky underground and the equally choosy label Crunchy Frog about their potential.

Shiny Darkly’s dark rock'n'roll is perfect for anyone who feels that the clock is always just a few minutes to midnight.

Label: Crunchy Frog

Henry Laufer – the real name behind Shlohmo – is a child of the same Los Angeles that has delivered former Roskilde artists such as Gonjasufi and The Gaslamp Killer.

He is only in his early 20s but he is soon-to-be recognised as one of the stars in the major city's underground.

The young beat smith cuts into a personal niche with his delicate, electronic music. The music is based on several thresholds, including abstract hip hop, nature programme soundtracks in the vein of Boards of Canada and post-London dubstep.

Shlohmo is the sound of an unruly, creative Los Angeles. A music mecca in its own right next to New York.

Label: Friends of Friends / import

item.text: Grime hip hop with attitude and clenched fists.
item.description:
The Copenhagen hood Nørrebro is no longer the sole destination for fans of homegrown grime hip hop. The Copenhagen suburb Vangede is also worth namedropping among fans of Danish-language, sharp-tongued rap.

Sleng consists of two high school lads, Aesthetic & Larry, full of attitude. They have embraced the originally British hip hop variety and have already become major players on the scene. YouTube and Facebook have been the right channels to create a solid fanbase.

Sleng’s pared, angular songs are filled with witty blows and clenched fists. Sensitive souls better go in hiding.

Andreas Asingh's new solo project is shrouded in secrecy and mystery.

It's obvious, however, that Asingh knows how to produce electronic falsetto pop songs that could get both disco godfather Giorgio Moroder and pet shop boy Neil Tennant to shout with joy.

Don't think that Slowolf is only for people who love crisp synths and light vocals. The coming debut album contains a visit from hip hop king Raekwon from Wu-Tang Clan.

Label: Slowolf / A:larm

item.text: Clubby Copenhagen slum hip hop with a party guarantee.
item.description:
Danish-language hip hop is a stoned city full of rocking beats.

Using Shanksville as an imaginative place, Specktors fill their self-titled debut album with twaddling strokes of genius about pubs, apocalyptic hangovers and tribal tattoos.

On a sizzling bed of clubby electro, the troublemakers shits between cheeky, silly and benighted.

Specktors are the guarantors of a hip hop party full of attitude. 2012 also offers a new album from the four nightclub pirates.

Label: EMI

2012 may very well be the year for Spector.

Front man Fred MacPherson is in his early 20s but has already been in several bands. As the lead singer of Spector the equation seems to be solved. And now things are really speeding up.

The suit-clad boys have been called London's answer to The Strokes, but judging from the first singles the five-piece sounds more like a new shoot off the same branch as Roxy Music, Pulp and The Killers.

Spector has the right mix of youthful zest for life, quintessential British weltschmerz and humorous tongue in cheek to go far.

Label: Luv Luv Luv / Universal

With a point of departure in the ballad and folk tradition, Spillemændene conquer their own baroque, literary universe.

The lyrical universe is filled with equal parts pathos and humour, ands the songs in major reveal a great passion and understanding of the classic songwriting craft.

Nicolai Elsberg has a sonorous voice and is an original storyteller, like a young Danish version of Leonard Cohen.

The rock band Spleen United seems to have disappeared. From the ashes rises a changed creature. An all electronic, neon-coloured rave band for people who – even on the dance floor – demand a shot of melancholy in the music to get their feet to move.

With School of Euphoria, these depressive young lads of pop throw themselves completely into the arms of electronic dance music that makes the mirror balls spin in synthesized ecstasy.

Their 2012 sound is at the same time light as helium and weighed on by the same depression that gave the band its name.

Spleen United still feels pain deep down inside but the euphoria of dance music has also become a steady partner.

item.text: Gloomy hip hop prince from the Johannesburg townships.
item.description:
Imagine an acid trip in Soweto, Johannesburg after midnight, translated into music. That's just about the sound of Mathambo.

With a grimy mix of electro, rap, South African house and dystopian bass music –genreless "township tech", he calls it himself – this dark hip hop prince will soon become a new name on the global guerilla pop scene, led especially by M.I.A.

Spoek Mathambo is claustrophobic but danceable midnight music, filled with robotic beats and rough ghetto sounds.

Label: Sub Pop / Target Distribution

item.artistName: BRUCE SPRINGSTEEN & THE E STREET BAND
item.text: One of the biggest rock icons takes Orange Stage.
item.description:
Get ready for some ”Glory Days” at Roskilde Festival when Bruce Springsteen takes the iconic main stage. Having this denim-clad superhero on Orange Stage is no longer a dream scenario.

In 2012, he and his faithful E Street Band will fill a summer’s night with poetic rock songs about New Jersey, the hopelessness of blue-collar working days and life on empty small town streets when you are born to run.

Bruce Springsteen's influence on rock history can hardly be overstated. Without this masterful songwriter and storyteller, younger bands such as Arcade Fire and The National would not sound the way they do.

Regardless of age and knowledge of Bruce Springsteen, it is practically a civic duty to experience this artist who – despite his simple and unpretentious craft – towers up on the rock horizon.

Columbia / Sony Music

Scandinavia has recently developed its own electronic underground dance genre. It is called skweee and is an odd distortion of British bass music and electro funk, typically performed on outdated computer equipment.

Mr. Sprutbass, Eivind Henjum, claims that he and the people from the Dødpop label have created skweee 2.0 – a special variant of the sound from Norway.

Look forward to some morbid electronics – of fierce, freaky and genre-founding kind.

Label: Død Pop / import

item.text: Life-affirming rumba from the depths of the Kinshasa slums.
item.description:
They excited on our Cosmopol stage with a great funk party in 2010 when all skeptical misgivings were groundless.

Staff Benda Bilili is a group of Congolese polio survivors in wheelchairs who, despite poverty and disease, have developed a stripped-down but smiling mix of rumba, soul and congotronics. A contagious musical acquaintance filled with insisting rhythms and compelling call-response vocals.

Staff Benda Bilili steadily moves upwards on the global music scene. The sympathetic and always impeccably dressed band conquers Roskilde Festival again.

Label: Crammed Discs / import

item.artistName: DJ STATIC w/ TEMU, BLOOD SWEAT DRUM+BASS and GUESTS
item.text: Danish hip hop extravagance with over 80 participants.
item.description:
"The backbone of hip hop is the DJ."

Simply put and very apt for this extravagant setup where DJ Static leads a 27-piece big band and plays his coming album Rolig Under Pres in its entirety.

It’s an album, and a concert visited by Danish acts such as Jokeren, Peter Sommer, Orgi-E, Per Vers, Raske Penge and Swedish rapper Promoe – among many more.

The huge setup has over 80 musicians, rappers and singers and is seasoned with hip hop classics, breakdance and freestyles

A unique show created especially for the best audience in Europe.

Label: Playground

With three albums under the belt, Suicide Silence are uncompromising and persistent young lions from the metal scene.

The third release is called The Black Crown. Here they overwhelm a growing crowd of disciples with deathcore, filled to the brim with growling and screaming vocals, manic intensity and explosive energy.

The band has learned from the busy touring schedules and has taken the most brutal parts from the previous albums. They have constructed an even fiercer beast that, according to the band, "attacks, attacks, attacks".

Show up and take some beatings from a fast-paced hard sound from a confident band who is ready to take the lead.

Label: Century Media / EMI

item.text: Jewish cantor singing mixed with global, eclectic beats.
item.description:
Jeremiah Lockwood has the spiritual Jewish music as a starting point for his tradition-bound project The Sway Machinery. He plants the chanting, vibrating cantor singing in a gaudy flowerbed of African, East European and Middle Eastern sounds.

At the same time, the interplay and the brass band guarantee a playful and rocking atmosphere, lifting the ancient music traditions to a higher level of funk and Afrobeat-like music.

The many musical impulses, inspirations and impressions will ensure that The Sway Machinery will be an unpredictable visit to the synagogue.

Jdub / import

item.text: Copenhagen DJ with preference for global beats.
item.description:
With a preference for kuduro, cumbia and other global beats, Julius Sylvest – who is also a part of the DJ crew Lortehænderne – is obviously a DJ after Roskilde Festival's multi-coloured musical heart. And we are not alone in our opinion.

Reportedly, Diplo has also given this Dane a nod of acknowledgement.

Julius Sylvest guarantees Hawaiian shirt-patterned, electronic festivities filled with insisting rhythms and Caribbean heat.

Label: Palms Out Sounds

Through their basic combination of beauty-insulting guitar playing and minimalistic drumming, Talk Normal revive New York as the capital of musical noise as it once was in the early 80s under the banner of no wave.

The Brooklyn duo – consisting of Sarah Register on guitar and Andrya Ambro on drums – rips through songs that sparkle with dissonance, energy and wildness.

Being completely non-dogmatic and cool, Talk Normal sets a noisy agenda that once more makes jarring guitars sound fresh, frothing and dangerous.

Label: Rare Book Room / import

As the band name suggests, Team Me was just supposed to be Marius Hagen's solo/side project. Instead, things sped up.

Today the six-piece Team Me is one of Arcade Fire's most obvious rivals. The Norwegian media have hailed the band's debut album To the Treetops as one of the best in Norway.

Team Me plays grandiose indie pop, and the catchy, joyful and majestic songs have international potential. At the same time, the Norwegians have an unmistakable Scandinavian sound as if they shared helium with Mew and Lukestar.

Label: Propeller / import

item.artistName: JØRGEN TELLER & THE EMPTY STAIRS feat. LAZARA
item.text: Chaos-free-rock with a visiting Belgian drummer.
item.description:
With two drummers – Tobias R. Kirstein as a regular feature and Belgian Lazara visiting – Jørgen Teller & The Empty Stairs become an experience out of the ordinary.

And with this well-established underground phenomenon, ‘the ordinary’ is already the deepest well of punk rock. Presenting a combination of improvisation and psychedelic energy the guitarist Jørgen Teller, bassist Søren Gorm and the rest of the entourage short-circuit your mind with beautiful noise where the entrance to heaven is sprinkled with rusty nails and tricky pitfalls.

Jørgen Teller is a Danish Captain Beefheart who is ready to let the willing into his fold.

Label: Rillbar

Berlin's equivalent to Battles, Ter Haar, started out as an instrumental band, which you feel in the musicality and attention to detail in all of the trio’s songs.

The ambition is edgy, complex post-rock that makes you want to dance rather than count time signatures. A difficult balance that Ter Haar achieves on the album Delta where guitarist Philipp Koller makes his debut as a vocalist.

Ter Haar is a treat for both your brain and dancing shoes and proof that challenging music doesn’t need to be without a sense of humor.

Label: Sinnbus / Import

item.text: The next big desert blues phenomenon.
item.description:
Roskilde Festival brought the Sahara desert blues to Europe with Tinariwen who played their first concert outside of Africa here. Now we present Terakaft, another big orchestra from the sandy plains.

The band has previously shared members with Tinariwen, and Terakaft means caravan in the blue people's, the Tuareg, language.

When you hear the music you can almost feel the desert sun burn down on the wrapped-up musicians.

Look forward to some sunshine-saturated Bedouin rock full of thirst, spirituality and shimmering electric guitar sounds.

Label: Harmonia Mundi / import

Don't be fooled by the optimistic and 'seize the day'-ish band name. Today Is The Day is a brutal, sonic pummeling, which will leave even the most hardened metalheads with deep scars on their souls and big grins on their faces.

With legend, riff wizard and daredevil Steve Austin at the helm, Today Is The Day is a style-defining and cultish band of the extreme.

With jagged rhythms, metallic brutishness and a geeky attention to detail, these veterans carve their own bloody niche in today's metal scene.

item.text: British-Caribbean dance party with a Sheffield prodigy at the helm.
item.description:
Sheffield's own Toddla T has DJ’ed longer than he has been able to obtain a driver's licence. Today he is a well-established British DJ act, for instance at the hot London club Fabric and on BBC Radio 1.

With The Toddla T Sound, the prodigy enters the stage. Based on the two albums Skanky Skanky and Watch Me Dance, Toddla T now goes all the way with a show featuring a sonic vortex of dancehall, house, garage and countless other dance genres from both Great Britain and the Caribbean.

The Toddla T Sound is packed with bass, lights and visuals. A calorie-burning session that simply requires you to dance.

Label: Ninja Tune / VME

How would Kraftwerk’s robots sound if they grabbed the acoustic guitar? Touchy Mob presents an idea of this scenario.

Despite the band name, this is an austere solo project where the bearded Ludwig Plath with his acoustic guitar, a little electronics and angular time signatures create a personal sound that alternates between organic warmth and cold electronic dystopia.

With few means Touchy Mob creates his very own "folk techno". An odd musical variety, which still makes fully sense when experienced live.

Having played for over 40 years, Boubacar Traoré (also called Kar Kar, the dribler, in his football-playing youth) makes his Roskilde debut, and not one day too soon. Actually, it's a minor legend whom we can finally welcome at Roskilde Festival.

With a voice that sounds like it has slow-ripened in the sun, Traoré plays the blues with the acoustic guitar as the main accompaniment. Humble and intimate music, often frayed by melancholy.

Don't miss a meeting with a West African veteran whose status in his native country is on par with Ali Farka Touré.

Label: Lusafrica / import

item.text: Hardcore riots by one of the genre's most talked-about bands.
item.description:
You shouldn’t really use too many words to describe a band such as Trash Talk. With this kind of hardcore band, it's all about getting into the eye of the storm and sweat off a few pounds.

Screaming, vocal cord-wrecking voices and aggressive riffs dominate Trash Talk’s ultra short and unmelodious punk songs that often transform band and audience into one giant monster with arms and legs sticking in all directions.

Lead singer Lee Spielman is undoubtedly one of hardcore’s most hardworking front figures. His energy and dedication has already made him semi-mythological in the genre’s circles.

Label: Trash Talk Collective / import

Merrill Garbus has thoroughly studied the great cookery book of pop. However, it seems that she has read it backwards and upside down.

WHOKILL, the second album under the moniker tUnE-yArDs, has made the woman with the androgynous African voice the new prodigy of mad pop. A sister-in-spirit of Animal Collective, Björk and Dirty Projectors.

Garbus' music waddles and hobbles charmingly out there, high-fiving East Africa, R&B, hip hop and avant-garde along the way. A kind of sunshine pop for hyperactive, playful people with paint in the face and pumping blood full of glucose.

Label: 4AD / Playground

Ulige Numre has achieved an immediate recognition from the audience, a recognition that many similar bands can only dream of. Their debut single “København” has been the dark month’s soundtrack to many Scandinavians.

The young lads are in their early 20s, but they play lyrical, lovesick Danish-language rock with a confidence and stage presence as if they were an older and more experienced band.

They’re delightful proof that good songwriting is still relevant to a wide audience.

Auditorium / A:larm

British band The Vaccines have marched straight into the hearts of both the music press and audience.

The formula behind their music is a tried and tested one, but nonetheless very effective: catchy rock that just about contains the quintessence of every band of quality ever to grace the loudspeakers of any Ramones-poster-decorated teenage room.

The band has in a disarmingly self-ironic manner called their debut album What Did You Expect From The Vaccines? The answer to their question is: great things, judging from the many hits on the album. These Brits are sure to meet the expectations on their follow-up album, due later this year.

Label: Columbia / Sony Music

Paris calls for a soundtrack of accordion, glockenspiel and sweet charm.

Maïa Vidal is a worldling with New York, Montreal and Barcelona as her home turfs, but her primarily English-language songs bring about a feeling of the city of lights.

Her music is rich on classic Seine atmosphere. Meanwhile, the singer is not afraid to include a cover of punk idols Rancid whom she has previously paid tribute to on an entire EP.

The well-traveled Parisienne uses accordion, guitar, violin and various toy instuments in her both playful and nostalgic universe.

Label: Crammed Discs / Cosmos Music Group

item.text: Melancholic pop on a bed of playful electronica.
item.description:
With academy studies in electronic music as the ballast, Soffie Viemose is about to unfold her name as one of Denmark's most promising acts in semi-experimental electronica.

The young producer and singer's delicate electronic arrangements contain a creeping sadness. At the same time, the many details show a playful mind at work. With her wistful voice and the evocative lyrics at the centre, here’s a treat for both fans of abstract electronica and melancholic pop.

Label: Polar / Playground

item.text: Outsider hip hop from the Norwegian province.
item.description:
Coming from down south – southern Kristiansand, Norway, to be more specific – it can be hard to make yourself heard when producing Norwegian-language, British-inspired grime hip hop.

However, Vaagsbygd Handy has managed to do just so where Norwegian, British and Jamaican currents meet. With an East London edge and a motley array of words, Vaagsbgd Handy shows the way with unruly hip hop full of humour, heavy bass, Caribbean riddims and a well-developed sense of the absurd.

The Copenhagen punk scene experiences quite a boost these days with Iceage as the internationally noted figurehead. The scene is still small. Everyone knows each other.

War For Youth is a constellation put together for Roskilde Festival, a cross between War and even-minded Lust For Youth.

The two bands have in common industrial icy synths, effects-drowned vocals and an indefinable sense of something new and dangerous. Raw, nihilistic and misplaced – like only the darkest and strangest alleys in Scandinavia sound right now.

Thrash metal has enjoyed a renaissance where metal lovers brought into the world several years after Slayer’s Reign in Blood have discovered the genre's potential.

Warbringer belongs to this wave and obviously adore 80s metal elements such as gas-guzzling tempos, long hair and wind-swept guitar solos.

But the Californian band is not just a tribute to bygone times. Hardened by intense touring and sweaty moshpits since 2004, the L.A. thrashers’ brutal songs mutate in new ways – often with a destructive undercurrent of death metal and newer, more progressive tendencies.

Label: Century Media / EMI

item.text: The biggest ambassador of Maloya music.
item.description:
Réunion lies east of Madagascar in the Indian Ocean. The tiny dot on the map has its own, original music. The ritualistic droning style of Maloya was created by the descendants of black slaves and has a strong appeal to the sense of independence in the islanders.

Despite his partially French origin, Danyel Waro is one of the most outstanding ambassadors of this culture. The islanders love him as a unique musician, poet, storyteller, freedom fighter and commentator.

Waro's mission is not to make Maloya easily digestible and streamlined for the global audience. He creates a magical presence with this percussion-based music from his native home, which at times can seem to overtake and overwhelm your senses.

Label: L'Autre Distribution / import

In 2012 we’re giving you another dietary supplement from the swampy US Southern states, filled to the brim with toxic heavy metal and questionable types of tobaccos. The initiated call it sludge.

You could also simply describe Weedeater’s sound as a groovy cross between AC/DC and Black Sabbath, played by a group of bong heads with a Dixie flag hanging in the rehearsal room.

Front man "Dixie" Dave and his cronies are without a doubt good-natured Southern folks – the band's first album was called ... And Justice For Y'all with a howdy to Metallica's classic. The music, however, is a deadly mixture of fast riffs, whipped drums and growling vocals.

Label: Southern Lord / import

item.text: One of the most important rock voices and guitarists of the new millennium.
item.description:
The White Stripes helped kick-start rock again a little over 10 years ago. With inspiration from particularly blues and garage rock, Jack White showed us all how much magic you can produce with vocals, guitar and a drum rhythm from the missus.

Having expanded his repertoire with the super rock groups The Raconteurs and The Dead Weather, Jack White now takes the stage himself, and the first live shows reveal an artist at the peak of his career. Ready with songs from the new solo album, Blunderbuss, and picks from the rich back catalogue.

With a bigger band, the old songs are given a new wealth and weight. The new songs are potent rock noir, full of more than 50 years of music history.

With Jack White, the reawakening of the classic rock tradition continues.

Label: XL / Playground

Sweden's perhaps most popular rock singer nowadays is called Lars Winnerbäck, a sharp observational troubadour with a bulging song catalogue and a huge ecstatic crowd celebrating him as one brightest shining lights of the Swedish songwriting tradition.

Loaded with his poetic lyrics and acoustic guitar, he is in many ways the epitome of the classic folk singer.

However, the Linköping pride is in no way musically stagnant or conservative. On his latest album Tänk om jeg ångrar mig, och sen ångrar mig igen, synthesizers and electric guitars move away from the ballad tradition, which has previously been the popular Swede's domain.

Label: Universal

You've probably heard "Black and Yellow", which has been a huge hit on the radio almost everywhere. With this festive and poppy tribute to his local NFL team, Wiz Khalifa went straight for the mainstream heart of the wide audience and gave both Drake and Lil Wayne a fight for their money about being the young generation's biggest hip hop hero.

The tattooed rapper from Pittsburgh is not as new to the game as his birth year (1987) might indicate. In the course of numerous mixtapes and other releases Cameron Jibril Thomaz has expanded his fan base with a persistence, energy and dedication, which also shows during live shows as a true contrast to his cannabis-seasoned and laid-back hip hop.

Atlantic / Warner

Alabama has no reputation as a hip hop mecca compared to Los Angeles or Detroit. At least not yet.

Yelawolf is one of the southern state city's new ambassadors and has, despite his skin colour, been the new black for some time in the global hip hop club.

A skinny country boy brought up on Lynyrd Skynyrd, but with an aggressive, vicious and virtuous rap style that places him just as much in the company of Tech N9ne as Eminem.

He is signed to the latter's Shady Records and the comparisons with this pioneer are inevitable.

However, make no mistake of Yelawolf. His music reeks of petrol, crunk, dope and white trash attitude, so you know it is made by a genuine Dixie.

Label: Shady / Universal
